campaign.story:
Muscle recovery is vital to allowing our body to move and feel better. Unfortunately, a lot of the products in the market complicate the process and don’t accomplish what they claim.  That’s why we created the Base and Balls. We wanted a better, more cost-effective, simple solution to help you get the relief you deserve -- in the comfort of your own home, at the gym, during a break at work, or when traveling. 
Plus, due to safety or financial restrictions – more people are staying home -- not many of us have the option of going out to get professional massages or investing in expensive gear. The average Joe just needs something simple and effective. Meet The Base and Balls -- where simple, modern design meets patent pending technology to target tight, sore, and strained muscles.
When my team and I started to design the base and balls system we wanted to ensure it would be a product that could bring you relief, anywhere without breaking your budget.  
The device is literally just a base and 3 custom massage balls. Don’t let the simple design fool you. The patent-pending system has been designed with my 8 year experience in the industry with the last 3 years spent on research and development to get us to bring this product to you. The Base with its detachable interlocking ball is made with your comfort, convenience, and relief in mind.  
The base and ball system is customizable and expandable.  You can use one or two units to personalize your relief. You can even customize the pressure with the included 3 custom made for the Base massage Balls which provide varying degrees of pressure.
Measuring just 4x2 inches, the Base is truly the world's most compact, convenient, and travel-friendly massage and pain relief recovery device. Small yet powerful enough to handle all muscle types and weighs less than one pound!
The base uses a custom-designed “massage ball” which is attached to a revolutionary accessory to optimize compression and assist with one of my favorite massage techniques “press and stretch”. “Press and stretch” makes the mobility exercise and massage active, which creates a more effective way to relax, and get the body ready to carry over to real-life activity. Owning the Base is like having your personal therapist ready to help you 24/7. 
The base and balls can travel with you.  Whether you’re at home, the office, gym, or traveling via car or plane, it’s now possible to take care of yourself anywhere, anytime.  Trust us, you won't want to leave home without it!     
The base and balls system has been tested on individuals of all ages, backgrounds, and fitness levels.  It's also easy to clean! 
Check out what some of our early users have to say about the benefits they felt with the base and balls.
You don't have to lug around chargers, batteries, or large bags to take the device with you. It fits in the palm of your hands, can be sanitized top to bottom, and made to provide you relief for a long time.
The Base is designed for maximum performance using variable resistance silicone to give you the feel of human touch. Utilizing a patent-pending interchangeable, 3 ball system, the Base makes it easy to quickly switch to your desired firmness level...allowing your muscles to relax into the base and melt your tension away. Powerful enough to handle all muscle types, the base weighs less than one pound!
Many of you know me through my social media channels as JoeTherapy. My real name is Joe Yoon. I’m a massage therapist and author of the best selling book, Better Stretching.  I started my social channels to teach people simple ways to stretch and move better.  I wrote my book to simplify complex techniques for the everyday Joe that’s just looking to move and feel better.  
My team and I have now created the base to allow you to do all this -- in the palm of your own hands. I am excited to get this into your hands in 2021 with the help of this kickstarter campaign!
Low Back Pain - Low Back Massage
Plantar Fasciitis Relief - Foot Massage
Tight Shoulders - Trap Massage 
 Tight Hamstrings - Hamstring Massage  
 Poor Posture? Try the Pec Massage
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Your Personal Risk and Reward
Just to be honest with you our supporter, the units you receive might look a little different than what you see pictured. But, that's also the the fun part of backing a Kickstarter campaign...you are joining our team for the ride as we bring these products to market. Yes, you are taking on a little more risk than if you waited until these products were available on our website. But you're also receiving a reward: you'll get the Base in your palms first, and at a significant discount (up to 50% off!). 

Supply Chain Risks
We’ve built a good relationship with our manufacturer and freight forwarder. Still there’s a lot in the supply chain we can not control. There’s space for things to go wrong. A machine at the manufacturer may break down. The ports may go on strike. These can cause a delay in fulfillment. 

Delayed Fulfillment
The fulfillment of rewards may be delayed for a few reasons: 1) Supply chain risks mentioned above or 2) our Kickstarter campaign BLOWS UP! (Of course, we’d prefer the latter.) We promise we’ll do our best to ensure that the Base gets into our supporter's hands A-S-A-P while taking care of the well-being of our team. Our target date to get it to you is March/April 2021 or sooner if we are lucky!

Unforeseen Quality Risks
We have worked with our manufacturer to ensure that our supporters receive products of the highest quality. Since The Base and Balls is an entirely new product, we cannot guarantee that it will be perfect. We kindly ask you to use this product with an open mind. We strive to provide the best products to help you live your best life, so feedback is always welcome! If you aren’t satisfied with your Base, we’ll stick by our Promise—a full refund, no questions asked. Just send us a message!

How will we overcome these risks and challenges?
Transparency. Through Kickstarter updates, we promise to let you know when things go wrong, right, up, and down. We wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for you. All that we ask from you is for your patience and continued support. You can always send us a message if you have any questions.

What if I no longer want to take the risk?
We can not offer refunds, returns, or exchanges on items received as Kickstarter rewards. The support our team gets from our Kickstarter backers is what enables us to complete our development and production process, run and grow our small business, and design new awesome products for the future. In the Kickstarter community, the items that you receive after making a pledge are referred to as "rewards" because they are not purchases in the traditional sense. We appreciate your understanding of our policy and the support you have given this campaign. Thank you!!!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Whipr is a 3-in-1 stand up paddle, cross country ski and rowing machine (+ more) specifically designed for your lifestyle.   
At just 6x6x6" (16x16x16cm) and weighing around 6lbs (2.7kg), whipr is conveniently sized to fit in any home gym, studio apartment or workout space. Get a full sized workout, pack it down in seconds and store it next to your sneakers
Whipr is also great for travel as it packs easily in your carry on bag (along with accessories) and is permitted to fly on airplanes... we've done it many times. 
Whipr started out as a way to replicate stand up paddling. Once the prototype was built and we started testing we realized it was so much more. Whipr is now a platform for many cardio and rep based exercises and the ecosystem can and will expand. Currently whipr has three primary modalities (exercises): 
Stand up paddling
Cross country skiing
Rowing
Each modality uses the same whipr base unit and is enabled by the use of accessories. You may purchase the whole package or choose just the accessories you need to match your training and exercise needs. Whipr will accept any handles, straps or bars commonly used on a regular gym cable machine (carabiner attachments)
Switching modalities is as simple as swapping whipr's orientation and accessories. This takes takes around 15 seconds so it's easy to set up HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training) sets using all three modalities. 
Whipr can be used with any cable machine attachments, like these velcro leg cuffs.
Additional modalities
SWIMMING/SURFING - Using two base units you can use our forthcoming swim and surf accessory for dry land practice and training. All backers who select two base units will recieve the swim accessory for free. 
KAYAKING - This is a much requested modality and again would need two units. We do not have plans within the scope of this campaign to release a kayak accessory but we do have one in development and intend to release it soon. Please see Update #13 for details.
GOLF, HOCKEY, SOCCER & MORE - In the same spirit of home mods we've heard from backers who plan to use whipr by attaching it to hockey sticks, golf clubs or to ankle   bands for kicking and glute work. We've tested these and they work great! Any ankle bands with a carabiner will work and they're all readily available on amazon. 
After much market research we decided to offer the whipr base unit on its own and add accessories so our backers can mix and match accessories to suit their needs. This keeps costs down for you and allows for ultimate customization. 
When pledging, please manually change the pledge amount to match the combination of base unit(s) and accessories you wish to receive. If you have already checked out you may do this manually in your account by modifying your pledge. 
If you have any pledge questions just reach out via the contact button and we'll assist. 
 The whipr base unit is essentially a miniaturized rowing machine 
with multiple modalities (exercises). It completely replaces the big, bulk rowing machines and ski-ergs that you'd usually only find in a gym, in fact to purchase equivalent quality machines for all three modalities would cost you over $4,000 and fill up a small bedroom. Whipr will cost you less than 10% of that amount and it's around half the size of a basketball.   
Get $4,000+ worth of functionaty for less than 10%
Key Specifications
Size =  6.2"x6"x6" (16cm) 
Weight = 6.7lbs (2.7kg) (Production model will likely be lighter) 
Pull cord length = 10 ft (3m)
Resistance on the catch (pull) phase of stroke = at its highest it's about the same as a full sized rowing machine on mid-high setting, at it's lowest it's an easier but  challenging resistance suitable for ski-erg and paddling. There are 5 levels of resistance in total that can be identified by numbers on the dial. 
Retraction resistance = none
Resistance Mechanism
The primary source of resistance is the planetary gearbox. Just like water, our gearbox is harder to get moving then keep moving. So once you build momentum whipr rewards your consistency with a slightly easier catch and pull (stroke), just like on the water. Additional resistance is achieved by increasing or decreasing the resistance wheel which engages magnetic resistance on the inside. You can read more about the engineering below.
Features
On the front of whipr is the pull cord, the digital screen and the inflate and deflate buttons for the inbuilt anchor. The rear of the unit features the resistance adjustment wheel as well as the inflatable anchor (the flap on the back) and the removable webbing anchor for anchoring whipr to any fixed object.
Front view showing pull cord, digital screen and inflatable anchor controls
Rear view showing adjustment wheel. Webbing anchor is installed.
Prototype notes
The images you see here are of the prototype. Improvements already planned for the production model are:
Increased size of the inflatable anchor to cater for large door sizes and carpeted rooms
Finalized the magnetic closure on door anchor to secure it in place 
Production model will be lighter, run quieter, smoother and have more variability in resistance (similar resistance to full sized rowing machines on mid-high setting)
Finalized design of the digital screen (see below for more)
Updated the logo
 As part of our partnership with Rich we're producing a limited edition base station with black accents coupled with our complete package. The package also features two bonus fitness programs including a free month of his own MayhemNation.com. The package is available now in limited quantities.
In re-thinking the ERG machine we first had to figure out how to secure it. Anchoring to a door was the obvious choice but we didn't want to be limited, so we added a webbing anchor which allows attachment to any fixed object like a tree, couch leg, fence post or tent peg. Basically anything that is heavy or securely fixed to the ground. Whipr is supplied with a webbing strap for objects up to 24" however any webbing up to 2" wide will work.
Inflatable door anchor in horizontal and vertical modes
NEW: Thanks to a stretch goal, backers will now have an option to upgrade their units to have bluetooth connectivity. See update #12 for details
An ergometer, or ERG, is simply a device that measures work or energy expended during a period of physical exercise. Our onboard computer will display common metrics and features such as:
Per minute stroke rate
Total reps/strokes
Count up/down timer
Total distance
Time to complete distance
Calories burned
500m split 
Further, our app anable more customization and metrics. The exact details of the app are yet to be finalized. 
Our stand up paddle shaft has been developed in collaboration with Black Project SUP, manufacturers of world championship winning paddles and fins. The paddle shaft collapses into 3 pieces and is length adjustable to suit any height. The pieces are each 17.5" long and will easily fit inside a carry on bag (typical carry on bag height is 22-24").
The paddle shaft is a special blend of carbon fiber that is softer then normal paddles to give it a distinctive 'alive' feeling in your hands. We've spent a lot of time playing with the right compounds to get it just right and the action is endorsed by world championship paddlers. To attach the paddle shaft simply clip the carabiner onto the whipr base unit.
Our paddle shaft, perfectly sized for travel and for paddlers large and small.
Train outdoors by anchoring to almost any fixed object. Great for bootcamps!
The cross country skiing accessory functions similarly to ski-ergs you'll find in high-end and cross fit gyms. Resistance is engaged with both arms (isolated single arm resistance would require two whipr base units). We've built this accessory to be compact and travel easily while retaining full fluid motion.  
To use the ski attachment simply unfold it, hook it over a door frame, attach the pulley to the whipr base unit hook and start skiing. The cord length is adjustable with a convenient system built into the handles and when you're finished it folds down to just 10"x4" for easy storage and travel. 
Ski attachment folded for storage/travel
Ski attachment cable length adjustment
The rowing accessory was a true engineering challenge! It gives the feeling and action of a full sized rower while being extremely compact. When you're finished training, the rower folds down in around 60-90 seconds and can be easily stored.
Rower Specifications:
Weight limit = 350lbs
Total length = 72" (1.82m) inclusive of the mounted base unit and feet
Total height = 20" (50cm) inclusive of the mounted base unit and feet 
Track length = 50" (1.29m) from middle of foot placement to rear seat position. Suitable for individuals with an inseam of 38" or less (individuals up to 6'6")
Seat height = 8" (20cm) from floor to seat position
Seat to pull cord distance = 9.5" (24cm)
Exact dimensions are subject to slight change
Updated wire frame CAD drawing of the final rower design
Prototype notes 
The photos you see here are of the prototype. Improvements in the production model are covered in our Update #11 and are displayed in the wire-frame above. To summarize we have
Raised and slightly lengthened the track. The foot plates are now located below the hips and ergonomics have been improved
Added non-slip feet (the previous version had non slip on the base, but this new version will perform slightly better on all flooring surfaces)
Wobble in the track and the pedestal mount under high intensity loads has been eliminated
Improved the method of attachment between the base unit and the pedestal (no more screw holding it in place)
Seat may be locked in place to accommodate different styles of paddling and adaptive users
Foot straps are longer and no longer velcro. Adjustment will be made with a more conventional double backed tension pull just as used on most full sized rowers
Faster setup and disassembly with quick connects, no small parts to lose
Easy snap down tension setting for solid rail feel and structural rigidity
Flatter, padded seat
Rower accessory taken apart (full deconstruct takes 60-90 seconds)
Plenty of room to spare when packed for travel
Demo of swimming action. User is laying on a foam roller to allow clearance on stroke. Two whipr units are used, one for each arm.
 The Swim & Surf accessory was put into development by the $500k stretch goal! We will share images in our updates as it is developed. Here's how it to set it up:
Anchor 2 x whipr base units under a door at a width that is suitable for your shoulder width. For example, if you have wide shoulders you'll set them further apart then someone with narrower shoulders. You can really fine tune the placement for your individual stroke which is a very unique feature of whipr. 
The Swim & Surf accessory will comprise of two handle paddles that attach to the whipr cord. Connect these to the base unit.
Position your own bench (such as a weight training bench, a Reebok step, cooler or tall foam block)  a few feet from the anchor point, centered with the base units.  
For swimming we suggest laying on your back as it frees up your lungs to work, visualize that the bench is the air and the air above you is the water. For surfing we recommend laying on your stomach as this accuratly recreates the feeling of laying on a board and paddling. 
Concentrate on your form and pull through the resistance exactly as you would on your board or in the water. 
All backers who select 2 base units (by adding $200 to their pledge) will receive the Swim & Surf accessory as a bonus with their shipment.
We looked at traditional rowing machines and how they provide resistance, decided to completely scrap all conventions and design the ultimate portable ERG machine from the ground up. 
To get the gearing right we started with an over-size unit, similar in size to a rowing machine you'd see at a gym, this enabled us to develop a proprietary planetary gearbox and clutch system that provides smooth resistance and a realistic paddling/rowing/skiing experience. 
Prototype #1 - Early development of the planetary gearbox
The challenge was to create resistance that is harder to get moving than it is to keep moving, just like in real life when the forward momentum of a paddler or skier results in easier stroke action, as long as momentum is maintained.
Prototype #1
Prototype #1 allowed the development of the planetary gearbox which we then miniaturized to create prototype #2. We also increased the resistance overall and added additional magnetic resistance so that your workout experience can be individualized.
Once we had the miniaturized planetary gearbox adjusted just right it was time to figure out how to secure whipr to a common object and make it as functional and portable as possible. We got the anchors dialed in and the whipr base unit was born.
 We love stretch goals!
Here is what we have in the works so far, more may be added during the campaign. 
"There I was sitting in a hotel looking at yet another filthy hotel gym thinking, why can’t I just get paddle fit wherever I want to? I searched around for a portable rowing machine, a sup machine or ski machine and found that nothing existed, so I built one that does all three." - whipr Inc. Founder & CEO Luke Tipple
Luke is a marine biologist, shark diver and SUP fanatic from Australia. He spends a lot of  time on the road, living out of hotels and boats filming documentaries for Discovery Channel. Having founded whipr he's now working full time to make it a reality. 
To build whipr he's teamed up with with Shape Products out of Toronto Canada. Their engineering and design firm have been in business for 30 years and have a long and solid history of bringing products to market, from inception through to production with their manufacturing partners. 
Also contributing as an advisor and paddle shaft manufacture is Chris Freeman, CEO and founder of Black Project SUP in Maui, Hawaii. His company makes world championship winning paddles and fins for stand up paddle-boards, surfboards and windsurfers.
As a team we're ready to hit go on production.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No Kickstarter project is without risk, but we've worked hard to assemble the right team to mitigate any unforeseen challenges that may present themselves along the way.

As the first of its kind, whipr is bound to make a splash in the industry. Knowing that we're doing something big here we've made sure that every step of our production timeline is protected by using trusted partners and realistic timelines. Every team member and manufacturing partner has delivered on products like this before, we know the business and the industry and there are no long shots involved.

We already have working prototypes of the whipr base unit and the accessories. There's no code to go wrong or electronics to bug test (aside from the digital display which is quite simple) and the molds are ready to be made, we're just waiting on the funding to do it.

However, it is important for backers to understand that sometimes timelines can change. For example, manufacturing and shipping has been delayed for some projects due to such things as viruses and travel restrictions. Right now we don't see that as being a problem as our supply chain is back up to full operations, but we are aware that the future risk of delay exists. 

We know it's frustrating to back a project and only hear crickets when asking about where the project is at, you won't get that from us. We commit to you, our backer, to be completely transparent along the way. You will receive regular updates on where we're at the the process, even when the only news is that we're on track and proceeding. 

We look forward to delivery on, or ahead, of time and getting whipr into every home, gym and bag of fitness enthusiasts around the world. Please feel free to ask questions, you'll find us very happy to talk about our new favorite work out machine.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Envelope Opener
The Standard Box Opener
The Hard Plastic Package Opener
The Zip Tie, Cord, Twine and Plastic Banding Cutter 
Handle and thumb rest
FLYK is shaped into a handle with a small thumb rest, making it extremely easy to grip and maneuver. This design helps provide stability, power, safety and accuracy.
Shielded stainless steel blades
Hold FLYK in any position without getting hurt. Carry it in your pocket without ripping clothes or piercing skin. Your kids can use it and you can even toss it to a friend without concern for injury. Can you say that for other scissors, box cutters or envelope openers? Probably not.
FLYK features cutting edge, super-heated and hardened long lasting stainless steel blades housed in a design that feels so good in your hands that you may arbitrarily start looking for stuff to open.
FLYK’s magnet and magnetic mount allow for FLYK to be placed wherever you want it to be, ready at a moment's notice. Most of us retrieve our package opening devices (scissors, razors and knives) from a drawer in the kitchen, or near our workbench or work area. Even if you choose to store FLYK in a drawer, the shielded blades prevent you from getting hurt.
FLYK’s body is made of Arboblend, a thermoplastic composed of three natural components: lignin, cellulose fibers and natural additives. It can easily be molded and is therefore called 'liquid wood'. By using biodegradable material, FLYK’s body will break down to become part of the earth should you ever lose your FLYK or accidentally toss it in the trash.
Additionally, FLYK can help you cut up boxes or plastic for recycling purposes, taking care of the environment even more. We're teaming up with environmental groups across the globe so that we can help support efforts to mitigate human impact on the environment through the sales of FLYK.
As one of the first crowdfunding marketing agencies, Enventys Partners has brought more than 750 crowdfunding projects to life through lead generation, campaign page creation, public relations, email marketing, Facebook Advertising, campaign management and more. 
FLYK Products, LLC founder Robert Behan faced package opening frustrations for a long time. He watched his friends and family struggle to open multiple tiers of packaging. Not only did the plastic/cardboard/box battle take away some of the joy and momentum of opening gifts, but it was also frustrating, bothersome, and unsafe. People were reaching for scissors, keys, knives, screwdrivers and more in efforts to get things out. It was in that moment that he started brainstorming an easier, safer, faster way to open packages. He sketched a design, purchased molding clay and created an initial mockup. He recruited help from an engineer friend, and spent the past year working on the final design and prototype.
Making COVID-19 work 
Producing eco friendly products is just the beginning. COVID-19 has changed the way all of us across the planet live our lives and many who’ve been forced to work from home have come to appreciate the benefits and healthier lifestyle of being with family, time alone or hanging with our pets. And FLYK, Products wants to help promote this lifestyle. Starting with our first parts run, instead of having a faceless factory construct each FLYK, we’ll look to employ individuals and families with the desire to work from home, where they can assist us with assembly and shipment of FLYK package openers to our customers. Over the past months, our team has worked diligently at making home assembly and automated shipping a reality not only benefiting individuals and families wanting to work from home but also the planet, by reducing delivery distances thus decreasing CO2 output and giving back to local communities through programs of cleanup and contribution with those we bring on board. This is just one approach FLYK Products is implementing in order help elevate human spirits, prevent and cleanup waste and work with other companies to make packaging of all kinds, healthier for all of us. 
We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make FLYK a reality.
We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, so even if you can’t give a dollar or pre-order FLYK, if you’re a supporter of FLYK, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

updates.update_content:
UPDATING OUR APRIL UPDATE
OUR APOLOGIES FOR MISCOMMUNICATING
Hello Kickstarter Backers!
In our February Kickstarter backer newsletter we let you know we’d be upgrading everyone’s FLYK order to the improved FLYK 2.0 and that we’d begin manufacturing in April. I incorrectly wrapped up March’s newsletter stating “we look forward to having FLYK(s) in your hands in April!” Please accept my apology, that statement was a mistake.

HELLO KICKSTARTER BACKERS!
Thank you again for backing our Kickstarter project, let’s jump into April’s update. And just to let you know, we delayed the release of this update because we needed wrap up testing before sharing a more accurate timeline (below) for delivery of FLYK to your door.

NAMING FLYK’S MASCOT

Hello FLYK Backers and thank you again for supporting our Kickstarter campaign. The update portion of this email will be brief and I'll jump right in. One of two improvements implemented focused on strengthening the blade cartridge by adding material to critical areas and the second saw us extending the lower lip of the cord cutter entryway helping improve performance. With improvements complete and manufacturing starting, let's segue into today’s newsletter by revisiting FLYK’s P3 initiative which is all about People, Planet and Packaging.

Hello FLYK Backers and thank you again for supporting our Kickstarter campaign!
This month’s backer newsletter starts with some exciting news. During the down time between receiving blade materials from abroad, testing, blade prototype production and then retesting in FLYK prototypes our team took on an inspiring challenge. A question was posed…”what might FLYK 2.0 look like and (due to blade delays) would we be able to have it in the hands of our first customers, all Kickstarter supporters?”

Happy New Year FLYK backers and thank you again for supporting our project. 
In the last update we’d shared with you the difficulties we were having with our blade manufacturer and those challenges have caused us to secure another manufacturer. With a new supplier, comes a new round of blade testing to ensure FLYK’s specific requirements for extended sharpness and durability.
On the eco side of things, our goal of making FLYK as eco-friendly as possible has taken us down many paths and we’re excited to share with you an update for the handles. Originally we looked into materials that would biodegrade and we were happy with this way of thinking. Not to rest on ones laurels, we challenged ourselves with the question, “could we be greener?” In short, the answer was yes. The materials to manufacture FLYK’s biodegradable version would have come from discarded plant sources which take a great deal of energy to process. So we were really excited when we discovered a material that uses less energy to manufacture, is made of recycled materials and is recyclable at the end of its life cycle. In essence, we’re taking nothing directly from the earth nor putting anything in. And the new material has changed the look of FLYK. Instead of a wood type finish, FLYK will now have a matte black appearance making it sleek and modern.

updates.update_content:
Hello FLYK Kickstarter Backers,
Happy December, we hope everyone is staying healthy and in good spirits as we make our way into the holiday season and move towards the turn of a new year.
In last month’s update we shared with you delays surrounding the initial release of FLYK to Kickstarter’s backers due to changes in overseas business climate brought about by Covid-19. Over the past month and a half, we’d secured deals with new suppliers including a primary manufacturing provider who will produce and assemble the majority of parts, integrate components from other manufacturers, conduct quality control inspections and deliver product to us as soon as possible.

Hello FLYK Backers,
Thank you again for being part of our journey to bring FLYK to you, our first fans and customers. I’ll jump right in because we’ve had an unexpected month of delays due to COVID-19’s effect on the manufacturing sector in China. In an article I’d read in The South China Morning Post they’d shared that over 460,000 businesses have closed in the first quarter alone since the pandemic started while others have been forced to reduce staff and cut salaries for employees they were able to retain. While our goal is to have assembly completed in the U.S., FLYK's components are manufactured in China. Of FLYK’s suppliers, two were affected causing us scramble to find new business partners. Over the past month we’ve reached out to nearly thirty new manufacturers and vetted those meeting our quality standards. Now we're back on track.

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
Thank you again for your support, we’re excited that you’re with us!
Over the past month Team FLYK has been busy tweaking minor design changes for improved performance and at the same time taking a deeper look into the materials used to manufacture FLYK. Durning several in-depth conversations with our materials’ advisors we’d gained a greater understanding of lifecycles for durable goods such as FLYK. These new insights have inspired us to look into materials more fitting for typical household lifestyles, helping us improve upon our commitment to planet stewardship. For example: FLYK has been designed to be with you for life however, if blades are damaged or dull over many years of use, we want to ensure that the materials discarded during blade replacement are able to be recycled. Go ahead and take a look at the “planet” section of our P3 initiative ( ) and you’ll understand our passion for the use of planet healthy materials in our products. Once new materials testing is completed, we look to begin production and have FLYK(s) in your hands in November. Thank you again for being part of this journey together.

Hi FLYK backers,
Thank you again for your support. Just a quick update. After conducting final performance tests we've decided on a few functional changes that will make your FLYK experience better. We're waiting for approval of these design changes from our manufacturer and look forward to having FLYK(s) in your hands in November. 
COVID-19 has changed the lives of many of us and our hearts go out to those impacted. If you haven't heard, FLYK will be assembled in the United States by qualified families in order to help mitigate COVID-19's impact and as we grow look to implement the same in other regions of the globe. This is one of the steps we've taken in our P3 initiative () that's all about People, Planet and Packaging.

campaign.story:
On a film set, when lighting for beauty shots,  cinematographers use the biggest, softest lights we have, to make actors and models look their best. 
Why? 
A big light wraps gently around features on the face, and a soft light evens out skin tone and diffuses any hard shadows - so bumps and creases disappear. 
Created by Australian film professionals and based on these lighting principles, BIGSOFTI is a mobile, high quality, bi-colour LED soft panel that delivers stunning diffused lighting for better photos, videos and video calls on all your devices.
Universal clip fits all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands.
Shoe mount with 1/4"-20 thread fits all cameras, tripods and light stands.

Whether for a night out with friends or off to a shoot with a client, BIGSOFTI is easy to transport. Super compact, super lightweight and super bright.
The battery on our prototypes was 1000mAh.  In testing we have measured run times at approx:
95 mins at MAX | 140 mins at MID | 240 mins at LOW.
And full charge from flat is around 2 hrs. *Subject to battery age and weather conditions.
But with our stretch goals achieved, we can now upgrade the size of this battery by 1.5X to a 1500mAh battery - which will increase these timings.
USB-C allows for operation while charging, so if a need ever arises the unit can be run from a power source.
As we are injection moulding the diffusion panel, we will have full control of elements that effect the panel opacity (we'll be experimenting with the mix of composite ingredients / diffusing powders that give a glow effect etc). Once we have the tooling complete and can experiment with these options, fine tuning will take place to balance the LED outputs VS the diffusion opacity. As a result run times may vary up or down slightly in final production model.
While CRI is a commonly cited score, as a film professional, a more important rating is the Television Lighting Consistency Index or TLCI.  It also runs from 0-100.  Our LED rating of 98+ puts us in the range where any colour variation is so small, a film colourist would not consider correcting it.  

We've been hard at work over the past three weeks confirming the final details of our tooling setup - we have paid and signed our contract and have been working on the finer points of the design, with tool cutting due to commence any day. We have opted to work with a higher precision tooling company as it will both allow us to produce more units faster, and also deliver a product with a higher quality finish.  
We're also excited to announce that since we can now order at higher volume, we have been able to negotiate some rates and add a couple of pretty cool features that will now be shipped with every BIGSOFTI.
And after hitting our $650K Stretch Goal today - every single BIGSOFTI shipped to every backer will now have a 1500mAh battery!

My name is Al Morrow, I'm a Sydney-based TV commercial director who’s worked with global brands in both Australia and the US for over a decade.  
I'm the guy who walks into a room and has to fight the urge to adjust the lights. Lighting quality literally affects how we see the world, and yet so many people hardly give it enough thought.
Al Morrow lining up the frame on recent Volkswagen TV Commercial.
I know how important lighting is when filming, well, anything and because I shoot photos and videos on my phone all the time, I wanted to bring the same kind of high-quality light that I use on my film sets to my mobile.
Even though I’d been thinking of ways to bring film lighting to my phone, my ‘aha’ moment for BIGSOFTI didn’t come on set or even during a shoot. It came one day in the car. My wife was driving and her sister was in the backseat; taking selfie after selfie. She was holding up a jacket to cut out the direct sunlight and complaining that her photos either had too many hard shadows or were being blasted by the phone flash.
I commented to her, that without her knowing it, she was cutting and shaping light in a similar way that we would on a film set and that if she wanted full control of her image, she’d need to have a small, powerful, soft light with her. Her face lit up (no pun intended) 'that would be great!'. Many months later, she was the first person we started our tests on, comparing our soft light to the hard light of the phone flash.
Note the harsh light and hard focussed shadow from the single point LED on the phone (top left) VS much softer spread from BIGSOFTI (top right).
That was when I realised this was not just a product I would use. Everyone (director or not), uses cameras and anyone shooting photos or videos needs good light.
The first thing I did when I got home that evening was to look at what products already existed in this space. There were phone cases that seemed cumbersome. Products that were made with cheap, low-quality LEDs. Lighting attachments that were too big, too heavy, too expensive.
There seemed to be a gap in the market! I was curious to see if we could address these design flaws and make something better - and the BIGSOFTI journey began.
BIGSOFTI began with me in my office pulling apart LED products I bought on ebay and hacking bits together but it really shifted gear when I brought on the team at Vert Design. 
I was impressed by both their enthusiasm and their experience (they had designed products for clients such as SONY, INTEL, BMW and DEUS among others) and, from the outset, our partnership was a perfect combination of my knowledge of lighting and photography and their passion for user-focused design.
We set off on two things: 1. Start on initial designs. 2. Find the right manufacturing partner.
Throughout the process, Head Designer Andrew Simpson spoke about product design being a 'swinging pendulum' between tech functionality and human interaction. Swing too far in one direction you lose the core practicality of the product, too far in the other direction and you lose the great user experience. We needed to make a product that was the perfect combination of both.
Initially, we created a light panel that would attach to the underside of a flip-out phone case. We found that while the function of the light module worked well, the user interaction with the design was lacking. We showed it to family, friends and colleagues who loved the effect of the lighting, but not the experience so we went back to the drawing board.
We explored fixed universal clips, magnetic blocks, locking rubber lugs, even a metal arm and shoe mount. We were split on the clip VS rubber lug and so decided to run some market research through the digital platform OnePulse, asking a focus group of 500 men and women 18-35, across the UK and US which design they preferred. A resounding eighty-five per cent said the clip-on design.
Our direction became very clear. Several iterations later, we now have a rotating, removable mechanism (patent pending), which houses a universal clip for all leading smartphone, tablet and laptop brands. Plus the additional features of a cold shoe camera mount with ¼” 20 thread mount and the 3M Adhesive Mount for general surfaces. It’s this simple versatility that helps put BIGSOFTI into its own category - being effortlessly transferrable across all your devices. 
We had our design, now we needed to get it made. After a false start with our initial manufacturer (bad communication, high costs, lack of knowledge and lack of passion about the product) we were put in touch with a man named Hunter Ho; an LED lighting product specialist.
During our first meeting with Hunter, we discussed the technical requirements of LED numbers, size, spacing and distance, colour temp,  CRI and TLCI ratings, the diffusing materials, batteries and charge times, circuits and regulatory approval checks. Hunter had an answer to all our questions and within a few days had sent us itemised quotes with unit numbers, costs, recommendations and timelines.
With Hunter’s input we were able to improve the lighting board and PCB layout, update the charge port to USB-C and increase the battery size and run time.  But most importantly, we were able to update the quality of our LEDs. We are now working with specialised, photography grade BI-COLOUR LEDs, so new that they may have never been used in a device this small before. They deliver changeable colour temperature functionality - with options for all scenarios - DAYLIGHT (5500K), TUNGSTEN (3000K) and a CLEAN MIX (4000K). Which means awesome colour reproduction for better images. We are super confident in our design and just as confident in our manufacturer. 
During these uncertain times in the world, shipping costs have gone up significantly, however, we believe these prices should return to normal as the global situation improves. To therefore minimise costs for our backers, we will not be charging the current higher shipping charges at the time of pledging.
Shipping, Taxes (and VAT / GST) will be calculated and paid for towards the end of the campaign, just before we ship out to our supporters.  This is being managed through BackerKit who will be in contact via email. 
We will be working hard to secure you the best shipping prices. The good news is that BIGSOFTI is small and lightweight, so any multipack purchases will be charged as only single postage fees, so please consider ordering for someone else too, to help us cut down on shipping costs and air miles.
We were always planning to launch BIGSOFTI in the first few months of this year, and obviously things have been a little held up by this very strange and difficult time out there.
We’ve stayed across developments of COVID-19 from the very beginning, as news of the pandemic first began to spread in China. We have adjusted our delivery timelines to take into consideration any delays that might be encountered as we move into tooling and production.
COVID-19 is certainly going to impact the way we work and communicate for the next little while. There is generally a movement towards remote working and this is only going to increase, and with that, comes adjusting to the new norm of endless video calls both for personal and business reasons. 
We know there is a lot about social distancing that has been difficult.  Never-ending video calls is just one minor impact of the current situation.  But if BIGSOFTI can help solve this one little problem then great.
We couldn't have got where we are today, without lots of help from family and friends. This whole thing has been done as lean as possible. From learning how to build a website, to hassling my poor friends to be in the videos. Harassing my brother Matt to help me film things. To asking my wife Jan for feedback during scripting. And a couple of favours finishing the content with Chris at White Chocolate in Darlington, and Tone at Rumble Studios in Chippendale. So to all those people - a huge thanks. Literally could not have done it without you all.
Chief Technology Cat analysing LED spectrum lab reports. LOL - No he's not. He's a moron.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been working on developing BIGSOFTI for nearly 24 months now and have built some great working relationships with our manufacturing partners.

If we are successful with our campaign, the team are ready to push the button on the tool making. As soon as we hit our funding goal, we can afford to pay the invoice at the factory to begin tooling.

We have every element fully costed out - so know exactly how to deliver BIGSOFTI out to customers - but as professionals with very high standards, we have identified a few risks that you should be made aware of that include:


1 - Manufacturing Schedule
 
We know things are going to be a little backed up with the factories as China moves back to full capacity, and this has been factored into our production timings. We have outlined a longer delivery time-frame of 6 months in the hopes that we will end up being able to deliver earlier than expected. 

We are working with a very experienced mould maker to manage our injection moulding process and a top electronic engineer and LED consultant to drive the component acquisition and circuitry construction.

It is critical to fully 'tune' the injection mould tooling to ensure we deliver BIGSOFTI to our high standards. The process of 'tuning the mould' has been described as sometimes more art than science. It can be quick or a can take a few passes to refine. The time to do this has been factored in, but if they nail it quickly, then it might be faster. But we will not be producing the first run of product until we are happy with the samples to make sure you will be too.

We can guarantee however to be fully transparent with communication updates so you guys know exactly how things are moving along. We want to make sure you love BIGSOFTI as much as we do - and won't ship until we know you will.


2 - Shipping and Handling

We think it's important to get BIGSOFTI out to you guys nice and quickly, but at the lowest cost possible.
Global freight and shipping is currently under the weight of massive demand and the road blocks of fewer flights and tighter borders. As such, costs for shipping are up (sometimes 2-3X) - which unfortunately is driving up our material and manufacturing costs somewhat, but this is something that we are absorbing at this stage to get BIGSOFTI off the ground.

Our shipping team are set to pack and send BIGSOFTI as soon as it's ready to go - but as with any postage, we cannot control the amount of time it takes once it leaves our warehouse. Global freight is currently burdened during this health crisis so timings and costings will be effected. We hope by the time we are ready to ship, that access has returned to some level of normality. But our plan is to maintain good constant communication with all backers so everyone is kept well informed.

In order to give you the most competitive pricing on shipping, we will not be charging shipping and taxes through Kickstarter but will be charging it closer to our delivery dates through BackerKit. With costs far higher than normal at the moment, but the assumption that things should return closer to normal over the next few months, we hope to get BIGSOFTI out to you guys for the cheapest possible price. 

We're working through trusted partners here so we're confident things will be fine, but please be patient as sometimes little hiccups in their system can cause a short (but understandably annoying) delay. 


3 - Minimum Orders

Backing our project is not the same thing as buying an off the shelf photography light. It is about supporting our idea that professional lighting principles should be available simply and easily across all your devices. 

To make this possible, we need to build enough support here in the KICKSTARTER community to get us over the line. This support will finally help us bring all our hours of research and development to life in BIGSOFTI.

To help make this idea a reality, we need your help in spreading the word.

If you like the look of BIGSOFTI, please click the green button and back our campaign. And please share it with anyone you think might also benefit from better quality lighting in their pocket. 

Every pledge we get helps bring us one step closer to getting BIGSOFTI into your hands, as quickly as possible, and for the lowest possible price. Thanks again for checking us out.

Reusability and recyclability

campaign.story:
TidyBoard streamlines your food prep by placing strainers, catches and containers on the end of the cutting board. Easily chop fruits or veggies without mixing scraps. Strain hands-free and effortlessly clean up with a swipe of your hand.
The hanging design and collapsible containers maximize countertop space and make food prep fast and fun!
Do you cook in a tiny kitchen?
By hanging off the edge of the countertop or over the sink, TidyBoard utilizes previously unused space. 
In addition, the collapsible containers save over 50% of drawer and cabinet space, making it compact in use and in storage. 
The cutting board acts as a lever to help hold the weight of the catch. TidyBoard’s bamboo is antibacterial and maintains durability for years on end. TidyBoard is lightweight and made from the finest eco-friendly materials.
The large catch and containers have volumetric and measuring marks. Put food waste or chopped up food directly into containers for quick cutting and prep. The containers are also collapsible for efficient storage.
The strainers nest into the end of the board for cleaning or straining directly into the sink or catch — hands-free. The Strainers are all collapsible making them compact for storage.
Lids come included to make food storage easy in the containers. The lids snap-on directly to the containers and have a vent which allows them to be microwavable. Clean it. Cut it. Store it.
The lids also have a vent release for steaming veggies in the microwave.
The TidyBoard was mindfully influenced by math and physics. Our board is engineered as a lever to stay steady even with a heavy load in the containers.
TidyBoard can hold up to 9 lbs of food in its container while hanging off your counter.
Cook and prep with ease. TidyBoard scientifically brings perfect balance to your prep. 
We’ve all experienced the cluttered counter and prepped foods mixed with food waste.
TidyBoard keeps you organized and your kitchen clean. Never worry about where to put scraps or discarded produce — keep your space clean and orderly with TidyBoard.
See the difference TidyBoard makes. Say goodbye to chaotic cooking and welcome spick and span prep.
Not only is TidyBoard cleverly designed, the quality of materials is nothing but the best.
TidyBoard uses eco-friendly Bamboo. The lightweight 4 lbs of the bamboo wood won't dull knives, harbor bacteria, or absorb unwanted flavors and odors.
The containers are constructed out of BPA-free Food Grade Silicone and are microwave friendly, convenient for storage and organization. 
You can choose your color once the campaign is over. We will send you a survey to pick your color of choice! 
TidyBoard cares about healthy eating, and we want to encourage everyone to cook fresh ingredients! We see TidyBoard making it easier to cook at home and helping prepare meals to-go, saving money and eating better when away from home.
We want to help connect people to their food and Mother Earth! Buying food locally at Farmers Market’s helps reduce the carbon emissions during long transportation journeys as well as the added packaging materials you typically see at markets.
With TidyBoard, cooking and eating locally grown foods can be easier and faster. Plus, the catch makes it super easy to compost all your food waste. Cut it, clean it, store it, compost it, and make our world more sustainable!
The TidyBoard Team are friends from college who lived together in a small apartment with a small kitchen counter to work on. It was constantly a mess with ingredients and no space, so we came up with TidyBoard! Next came testing different prototypes and many hours of us doing 3-D drawings on Auto-CAD and patent research. We bought a 3-D printer and started testing. We then met our main man Eddie, a master of manufacturing. He helped us turn our original solid plastic design into a collapsible silicone design and here we are now!
We are happy to bring this vision to reality!
Matthew is a goofy engineer who loves all things outdoors and creating new inventions!
Mark is a master of making businesses successful and loves spending time with family making delicious dinners!
William is the beloved brother who helped prototype and came up with the name TidyBoard!

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers, 
I hope everyone is doing well and staying healthy.  

EU Backers, 
Finally after an extraordinarily tedious process we finally have a solid confirmation and an actual ETA provided by our shipping agency for the EU shipment.  The shipping container will arrive in Rotterdam July 9th but I imagine it would be another week with customs and handling.  If anyone needs to change your address please email: info@tidyboard.com.   We are very sorry and quite embarrassed for the shipping delays and appreciate the minimal hate mail that we have received!

TidyBoard Backers, 

Please excuse the delayed update.  Many of you have received your boards and we are very thankful to hear good reviews, thank you for sharing!  If you have a product concern, please remember to email info@tidyboard.com and we will respond as soon as we can.

Dear TidyBackers, 

Our Second Truck Load is Half Full and will be Full by Thursday for shipment of the remaining U.S.A.  Packages with Add-ons.   The shipment for Europe and the rest of the world is still stuck in a shipping yard but should be making it's journey to the Netherlands, Hong Kong and Australia for the final deliveries for what is now looking like mid-March.  Seriously we are very sorry to everyone who has had to wait.  Please believe us when we say that all the TidyBackers have been on our minds constantly while we work to fulfill these orders.  This experience has been beyond humbling and our gratitude for each person who believed in this product enough to help us build our dream into reality cannot be put into words.  We still cannot believe a bunch of strangers around the world allowed us to start a business, you are all seriously the coolest people on Earth and we intend to pay it forward for the rest of our lives.

Dear Backers,

Backers should start to see their TidyBoard packages at the end of January and into the middle of February.  If anyone needs any address changes please email info@tidyboard.com.   There was a slight delivery delay, the first container was held up from shipping for two weeks at the distribution port due to extraordinary shipping queues.

TidyBackers, 
Here is a card to give to anyone who was supposed to receive a TidyBoard for the Holidays!  There are two sizes Small and Large.  Here is a link as well if the download from this platform doesn't work well: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1B9q7BygiLQpkTG6zunA5qNKQ09QUn1BY?usp=sharing

Dear TidyBackers, 
It has been a wild year for TidyBoard and for all of you no doubt, we hope everyone across the globe is doing ok.  We know how frustrating our delays must be for most of you and gosh we wish everyone was already using TidyBoard. 
But we have made many design improvements which required back and forth battles with our manufacturer on the large container having a handle vs. not having a handle, the solution for the Large Container and Large Strainer came down to a special cooling process for the Rim to prevent the bowing we originally were concerned about.  We had to try (6) iterations of the Anti-Slip feet so that they could be installed into the 3/4" board by the manufacturer.  We also tweaked the containers to be more rigid with thicker silicon joints and improved the lid to sit better on the containers.

Hi TidyBoard Backers,
I hope you are doing well and staying safe during these unprecedented times!
I just got off the phone with our manufacturer and they are currently assembling the TidyBoard packages and anticipate shipping the first container to our fulfillment center next week. Shipping during these times is more complicated than ever and we are doing everything we can to start delivering to our backers before the holiday. To help reduce further delays we are taking shipments when a container is filled in lieu of waiting until the entire production run is assembled. We will be shipping in order of your backer number and the total shipping process to deliver over 7,000 TidyBoard’s will take approximately one month from when our fulfillment center receives the first container.

campaign.story:
An Approachable & Comprehensive Online Video Series on Type Design   
Learn how to create your own type designs!
This online series aims to build a solid foundation of knowledge for what you need to know before embarking on your first typeface design, and then carrying it to the finish line. This series will approach the art and craft of type design from multiple angles, such as providing plenty of historical context in addition to practical insights into the type design process. Instruction for software tutorials will also be covered in depth using Glyphs App, a popular font design application. If this project is funded beyond the initial goal, I’m aiming to cover material that is discussed in intermediate type courses in addition to the foundations, such as how to expand your design into type families, how to use calligraphy in your design process, and more. 
(See 📚Table of Contents below for details!)
Who is this for?
Graphic designers, typographers, lettering artists, calligraphers, basically anyone who loves letterforms! Even if your goal isn't about becoming a professional type designer, there's many aspects of the letterform design process that is helpful for many related disciplines. After all, letters are the building blocks of communication design!
Trade Gothic Display, designed by Lynne Yun, released by Monotype
Introduction
Traditional access to a type design education involves resources and classes with financial or geographical barriers. I want to create this series because I feel strongly that the graphic design and type design community would benefit from having an accessible, affordable type design course, available from anywhere in the world.
While I have had the idea for this online course for a long time, the transition to online learning during this pandemic has been eye-opening as an educator. I've been teaching in-person classes for a few years, but the past semester has been a trial-by-fire where all learning had to happen remotely. With everything happening in the world, I feel that the community would benefit from having an accessible, affordable type design course now more than ever.
Just like my full semester classes, this course will be a mixture of type history, practical knowledge, and software demonstrations using Glyphs App. I'm a professional type designer who taught type design, lettering, and calligraphy for a number of educational institutions — you can check out my bio below.
TL;DR: I'm hoping to make an affordable & comprehensive online video series on type design! 
Ampersandist, designed by Lynne Yun, released by FutureFonts
 📚 What Will You Learn? 
Here is the list of topics that I am planning for this course, along with estimated minimum video length to show how much I anticipate going in-depth for these topics. 
 Foundations of Type Design: (1.5 hr+)
The anatomy of type
Typeface classification
Optical compensation
Plotting Vector Points
Languages vs. scripts
 Designing Your Typeface: (5 hrs+)
(Note: The class demos will use Glyphs App & Adobe InDesign)
Ideation 
Establish brief/parameters
Sketching
Common Novice Design Pitfalls
Digitization
Drawing Bézier Curves
Setting Font Info Values & Features
Spacing
Character Sets
Proofing
Kerning
Notes on Production/Finishing
The History of Type & Technology (1.5hr+)
Origin of the Alphabet
The Art of the Written Letter
Early Typefaces
Modern Typefaces
Contemporary Typefaces
 Educational Resources for Type (0.5hr+)
Archives & Resources for Type (online, in-person, & books)
Recommended Drawing Exercises
Where can I find and try out fonts in the wild?
Trade Gothic Inline, designed by Lynne Yun, released by Linotype
🚩 Stretch Goals 
After the initial funding goals are met, any additional funding will go towards expanding the course content to explain topics that go beyond the basics. 
TD;LR: Help me create the most in-depth type design course ever posted on the internet!
(~ $5000 Total) Diving Deeper into Type Design 
What is Hinting?
Opentype Features
Types of Numerals
Designing Accented Characters
(~$7000 Total) Designing Type Families 
What Are Type Families?
Extensions of Design Axis
Designing Bolder & Lighter Weights
Considerations for Optical Sizing
Designing the Italic Style
What is a Variable Font?
(~$7500 Total) Type as Technology
How Do Letters Appear on the Screen?
What is Unicode?
What is Hinting?
Font as Software (EULA/licensing considerations)
Details of OpenType Features
Different Types of Font file formats (.otf, .ttf, .woff, etc)
(~$9000 Total) Calligraphy for Type Design
How to Utilize Writing Tools
Carolingian Calligraphy
Experimenting with Writing Tools to Create Your Own Alphabet
 About Your Instructor  
Your instructor Lynne Yun
Hi! I'm Lynne Yun, a New York City based type designer and educator who specializes in typography, hand lettering, and calligraphy. I am proud to be teaching at educational institutions such as Type@Cooper, Parsons School of Design, and the Letterform Archive. I'm currently a board member of AIGA NY and was previously a full time type designer at Monotype, where I created custom typefaces for clients along with a number of retail typefaces, including the Trade Gothic Display and Inline families. 
Prior to that, I was a graphic designer at Apple Inc. in Cupertino, Deutsch NY in NYC, and served on the board of Society of Scribes, a non-profit organization dedicated to calligraphy. My academic background includes a BFA from the School of Visual Arts for Graphic Design and a postgraduate certificate in typeface design from the Type@Cooper Extended Program. Other recent endeavors include a residency at the School for Poetic Computation, and working on a masters degree at ITP in New York University. I'm honored to say that my work has been recognized by organizations such as AIGA, Type Directors Club and Art Directors Club, notably the Ascenders award which honors designers under the age of 35 who show remarkable achievement in typography, type design, and lettering.
Reward Details 
I ❤️Letters Sticker Pack  
I ❤️ Letters Sticker (work-in-progress)
(There will be at least two stickers. Here is the first one!)

 Handmade Flourished Card ($75+)
Flourished Handmade Card Reward
Why An Online Course for Type Design?
For a web-based course, the strength is that there is no limit to how many students can be on the other end of the virtual classroom. There are no geographical limitations unlike a physical classroom, and students can study at the pace and time of their choosing. Especially in the world of Type Design, there has been a lack of quality courses on the internet, and in-person classes have been rare except for a handful of cities in the world. An online course will not replace a full Master's program any time soon, but for those that have limited access, need a refresher, or are just starting out, an online course might be what they need.
Closed Captions and Subtitles
This course will aim to increase inclusivity and accessibility by providing English and Spanish closed captions.
BIPOC Scholarship
I am providing free class registration for anyone who identifies as BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, People of Color). Please feel free to share this submission form. Just as a reminder, the class series is recorded and so anyone who enrolls can take the class at their own pace.
How & When Will I Be Able to See the Series?
For any Kickstarter backers with the ‘Full Digital Access’ reward, there will be an access code emailed out in late June when the first batch of videos are uploaded online. The course will be continuously updated every couple of weeks with new videos, until the series are complete. The target goal for the complete course videos is late August to early September 2020. 
 Any Software/System Requirements?
A Computer with Mac Operating System
 Glyphs App (You will be provided with a free temp license! Details below.)
Adobe InDesign or similar text layout software
Official Support by Glyphs App
Glyphs: Font Editing for Everyone
Glyphs is providing free temp licenses for 'Type Design A–Z’ participants. They are also generously offering discount codes if you’d like to purchase your own unlimited license, which you can opt into when the campaign ends.
Why Should I Back this Project Now?
First, you’ll be helping this series come to life! Second, you'll get access to the courses as they get created this summer, and llifetime access to the course afterwards! Third, you’ll be getting a huge discount compared to the retail price when the full series launches. After the recording is complete, the course content will be retailing for more than the Kickstarter backer price.
Why Kickstarter?
A crowd-funding model with a minimum funding goal is a win-win for everyone. As an Instructor, I get to gauge interest for the series while being able to pay for the startup costs (setting up a website, getting recording equipment, footing living expenses, etc.). As students, you’ll get your money back if the series isn't funded.
Media Partner: FEMME TYPE
FEMME TYPE is partnering with us on this project to promote the campaign and project. FEMME TYPE, founded by Amber Weaver, is a platform that celebrates womxn designers in the type industry and community. Check out the FEMME TYPE book if you haven't yet, it's a beautiful book that celebrates women in the type industry.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The risks of this project are fairly low, since I'm experienced in running semester-long classes and most of the making costs have to do with my own labor. The main challenge lies in able to afford the the funding necessary to pay myself to work on this project full-time (living costs, student loans, rent, etc). However, even with the minimal funding goal, I am confident that this project will get delivered within the summer (by September 2020).

Hitch is the first full-size water bottle with a removable barista-approved cup hidden inside. The bottle and cup are full size (18oz bottle / 12oz cup), double walled, vacuum insulated, stainless steel, leak-proof, and BPA free. With a bottle you'll love, and a cup that's always with you, go zero waste and carry better.
Hitch's patent-pending design makes it easy to carry your bottle and cup together. Simply turn the crossbar on the bottom, and the cup releases from the bottle.  
When we set out to create Hitch, we talked to lots of people who carry reusable water bottles, and most wouldn't carry a reusable cup because it was either too much too carry everything, or too easy to forget at home.  
Simply making a tiny water bottle and tiny cup wouldn't cut it--people wanted a full size water bottle for all day hydration, a reusable cup large enough for a standard coffee drink with a lid that won't leak, and a way to carry both that was space efficient and easy to hold.  In fact, we wanted it to be so easy, that people could go zero waste.
Single-use paper cups and plastic bottles create a lot of waste. With Hitch, we've made the reusable bottle and cup so easy to carry, that you can go zero waste and lighten your load. 
We're including A FREE Bottle Protector with every Hitch. It's a flexible weatherproof cap that fits on the top or bottom of your bottle.  Protects the cup lid when it's on top, and when your cup is out, use it as a cap to protect the bottom of your bottle. 





Hitch is compact and easy to carry. It fits naturally in your hand where the bottle tapers in, much like a carafe. And at 9.5" tall, it can easily fit in a tote bag, messenger bag, or a backpack. We also designed the Hitch bottle and cup to fit in most cupholders.  
Hitch's cup is perfect for life on the go. When you're not using it, your cup is protected from the elements inside the bottle. When you're ready, the cup is the right size for coffee shop drinks (12oz), it's vacuum insulated to keep drinks warm, and has a leak proof and easy to drink from slider lid to keep things neat and clean.
If you use a paper cup at the coffee shop daily, it takes on average an entire tree worth of paper to make those cups a year. By using Hitch, you save a trees worth of cups annually. We also plant a tree when you pledge for a Hitch. We do it through our partnership with One Tree Planted, whose reforestation projects plant trees that clean our air and water, create habitats for biodiversity, and create jobs for social impact. 
If you use plastic bottles, much of that plastic isn't recycled but shipped to the developing world, where it ends up in rivers and waterways that flow into the ocean. By using Hitch, you prevent plastic bottles from reaching the ocean. We also prevent 100 plastic bottles from reaching the ocean with every you pledge for a Hitch through our partnership with Plastic Bank. They create impact in areas with high levels of plastic pollution, by supporting people to collect ocean bound plastic and turn it into a currency.
The Zero Waste Bundle includes everything you need to be sustainable in how you carry your daily beverages and food. We start off with a Bamboo Lunchbox that's made of bamboo fiber composite and a bamboo lid. It uses a flexible strap to keep the lid securely attached, and store the sustainably made Bamboo Cutlery.  
Lastly, the Bundle includes two flexible silicone straws and a straw cleaner. The straw which is compatible with the Hitch cup lid, can also travel with your Hitch! On the underside of the Bottle Protector accessory (free with every purchase), there's a stash area designed to store your straw in, so a straw is always with you.

How to Add-On an Extra Cup & Lid:

We set out to create the perfect reusable solution to carry your bottle and cup effortlessly. We knew it needed to be a great bottle, that carried its own cup inside, with the ability to carry enough water and coffee for an on-the-go lifestyle. After lots of concepts, prototypes, user testing, and refinement, we created Hitch.  
At Remaker Labs, we want to make life easier and more sustainable for everyone who carries food and drinks on the go.  As we look to the future, we're all about transforming our disposable-first culture into one that values sustainable living. In order to do that, we want to create storage solutions that offer a high level of convenience, yet are sustainable made and help people go zero waste. This idea, which we call 'conscious carry', is at the heart of what we do.

Long-lasting design
Hitch is made primarily from stainless steel, which is durable and highly resistant to staining, corrosion and other forms of wear. The non-metal parts of the Hitch are made from a durable and environmentally friendly composite materials that is made up primarily of bamboo, while other food-grade pieces are made from 100% recyclable HDPE durable plastic.
Reusability and recyclability
Our product is made from 100% recyclable or biodegradable materials, including stainless steel, bamboo composites, and recyclable plastics. Furthermore, we offset our plastic use by removing almost 10 times as much plastic from the waste stream, 1kg of plastic, through our partnership with Plastic Bank. In addition, by embracing reusable cups and bottles over single-use, backers can keep hundreds of non-recyclable paper cups and plastic waste out of landfills.
Sustainable materials
The stainless steel that we use is comprised of 70% post-consumer recycled steel, the highest level possible. The composite material that we use is derived primarily from bamboo, a fast growing, renewable resource.
Sustainable Distribution
We are certified 100% carbon neutral by Climate Neutral. We offset 100% of our carbon. That means all our shipping is carbon neutral. We're also optimizing shipping routes to reduce emissions derived from shipping and using sustainable and recyclable packaging materials wherever possible, and
Something else
From day one, we have been committed to building a company that makes a difference. To begin with, we offset 100% of our carbon footprint, and this commitment is certified by the great folks at Climate Neutral. But we didn't want to stop there. When you purchase a Hitch, two great things happen. 1) We make a contribution to One Tree Planted that covers the planting and sustenance of one tree. 2) We make a contribution to Plastic Bank that enables them to divert 100 ocean-bound plastic bottles, keeping them out of the seas forever.

campaign.story:
Sheet pan cooking is the easiest and most efficient way of making a delicious homemade meal.
There are lots of ways to cook on a sheet pan, but they are often wasteful or messy and not everything takes the same amount of time to cook.
We knew there had to be a better way...
Introducing Cheat Sheets, a completely new approach to sheet pan cooking.  Oven-safe, non-stick silicone dividers that will streamline your cooking and divide your ingredients, to make one-pan meals and meal prepping a breeze.
Everyone loves sheet pan cooking, but it’s not always as simple as putting everything in the oven together and coming back to find it has all cooked evenly. Reality is, not everything takes the same amount of time to cook. With Cheat Sheets, you can easily remove ingredients when they're ready and never overcook them again.
We get it... If you're new to oven cooking, it can feel like a bit of a science experiment that involves a lot of guesswork. That's why we've tested the most popular everyday ingredients and created an easy timing guide so that you’ll get perfect results every time.
Cheat Sheets are made for meal prep. With our modular dividers, you can cook all of your ingredients with even better organization and control. 
You can fit up to 6x small portions or 3x large portions on a single sheet pan and with multiple sets, you'll have everything you need to prep for the family or a week's worth of meals.
With Cheat Sheets you can easily separate ingredients and flavors without having them mingle. Whether you want to use different marinades, cook savory and sweet dishes at the same time, or simply don’t want your food to touch, Cheat Sheets has you covered.
Separation also comes in handy for families with different preferences, allowing you to create different portions for those with special dietary requirements or specific tastes - because not everybody likes pineapple on their pizza.
Aluminum foil and parchment paper are hugely wasteful and non-recyclable. Sheet pans are also notoriously difficult to clean, collecting stains and grime with every meal.
With Cheat Sheets you'll never have to scrub another sheet pan again and you'll save tonnes of wasted paper and foil. Cheat Sheets are naturally non-stick so clean-up is a breeze. They're also dishwasher safe!

The Cheat Sheets dividers are made with a premium, food-grade silicone material resistant to temperatures up to 450 degrees F. The dividers will fit on a standard half sheet pan or perfectly on the Prepd Sheet Pan included with each set.
The Prepd Sheet Pan is made from Aluminized Steel and coated with a non-stick PTFE and PFOA free coating.

Around 18 months ago we had an insight...
Out of all the Prepd Pack owners (now over 100,000 people), those who consistently meal prep all use sheet pans. But sheet pans have never changed since their inception. They are hard to clean, require you to constantly waste parchment paper and aluminum foil and are not designed to best serve how we actually cook, ie, multiple items in the oven at once.
We knew there had to be a better way. A solution that is easier to clean and gives ultimate versatility to the sheet pan. Allowing you to easily time each ingredient of the meal. A zero-waste solution removing the need to constantly create non-recyclable waste.
We were immediately drawn to silicone as it is completely food safe to high temperatures, naturally non-stick, long-lasting and resistant to bacteria. In our first phase of development, we tried dozens of different types of silicone and different colors to ensure our solution would be stain-resistant and have perfect heat transfer. Then we started our testing and prototyping phase. 
This is where we started cooking meals in the Cheat Sheets to ensure every dimension was perfect and more importantly, food cooked just as well as on a 'naked' sheet-pan.
We then opened our first tooling, received FDA approval and did a wider beta test. The feedback was phenomenal all round.After hitting our Kickstarter funding goal we have kicked off all of our final tooling so that production can begin shortly after the campaign end.
"Cooking just might be the single most important thing you can do for your dietary health . . . "Cooking just might be the single most important thing you can do for your dietary health . . . Cooking for yourself is the only sure way to take back control of your diet from the food scientists and food processors” Michael Pollan - Food Rules.
At Prepd we strongly believe that cooking for yourself or your family is the best and easiest way to stay healthy, especially during these challenging times. It doesn’t have to always be health food, so long as you cooked it and know the ingredients, that's enough.
Since we started Prepd in 2015 it has been our sole focus to help make preparing meals at home easier and more enjoyable. By creating tools and systems to help make healthy living easier, we hope to make healthy resolutions - lifelong habits.
Prepd was founded by two industrial designers, Chris Place & Will Matters. Together, we have designed and manufactured dozens of products and delivered product to customers all over the world. Our first product together was the Prepd Pack a reinvention of the lunchbox that was launched and successfully delivered to over 12,500 backers on Kickstarter in 2016.
Since launch, we've grown to a community of more than 100,000 avid meal preppers and talented cooks.
We can't wait to go on this next Prepd journey with you!
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
This project is promoted by Green Inbox.
