Over the last 4 years we have delivered over 100,000 products to customers all over the world. Over the journey, we have continued to improve how we work and the products we make.

We are now a globally remote team in Asia, Oceania, Europe, and America. We work around the clock and have honed the art of working separately, but together. 

Production

We have already completed an extensive pilot run, done in-kitchen tests and completed the silicone tooling. As soon as we are funded we will kick off tooling for the metal tray. The design has already been refined and approved by our engineers and is ready to go. 

We have mapped out the critical path and have made all necessary precautions to ensure we can scale production if we significantly surpass our goals.

We are very confident in our timeline, but it's our core belief to never settle for a mediocre product, so we won't be compromising on quality in order to save time. Supply Chain

We have built a very capable team that works hard to ensure smooth delivery of all our products. However, processing delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.

Covid-19

The health and safety of our team and partners is always our top priority. We follow all government-mandated guidelines and always err on the side of caution when it comes to the physical and mental health of our team and partners.

Our manufacturing partner for this product is operating at 100% so we are incredibly confident in our manufacturing timeline.

campaign.story:
Hello friends! As so many of us worry about the future and yearn to return to the glorious spring unfolding outside our quarantined windows, we're excited to bring you our newest, most enchanted project...

Created by illustrator Kevin Jay Stanton, this 78-card deck features traditional paintings rooted in classical tarot interpretations that delve into the lore and mythology of the plant kingdom.
For over five hundred years, humans have used Tarot cards as a tool for divination and meditation. Their archetypal symbols have mystical, philosophical and psychological implications that allow us to understand our past, our future, and ourselves. But even older than that is the symbolism we've always assigned to the plants that grow around us. Hermetic, alchemical and scientific traditions explore flowers as tools for making meaning, medicine and magic. 
BOTANICA marries the tradition of Tarot to a lexicon far more ancient: the natural vocabulary of life on Earth. 

BOTANICA takes all of the major and minor arcana of traditional Tarot and reinvents them in the language of flowers. The Queen of Swords is Red Oleander. The Hermit is a Chinese Lantern. The High Priestess is the Elderflower. The Devil is Nightshade.

The deck features  the complete set of 78 Tarot cards, illustrated with acrylic and ink paintings. The Major Arcana are defined by single plants and flowers, and the Minor Arcana are plants combined with the objects from their suit, with regalia on the court cards.
The cards are 3.25" x 4.15", printed on premium heavyweight card stock and emblazoned on the back with gold foil. Each deck will come with a booklet naming the plants and objects on each card, and explaining the symbolic meanings of each card. 
The set comes in three editions: THE HERBALIST, THE ALCHEMIST, and THE ENCHANTER. The details of each set are listed further down.
Divination is the process of finding meaning in symbols or patterns, and similarly the act of reading tarot is finding patterns, meaning and visions in the symbols. A larger picture is created when a story is formed from how one card interacts with the next, as a bouquet is created from the harmony between many flowers.
BOTANICA can be read in many ways, depending on what you’d like to get out of it. To start, you’ll want to familiarize yourself with the deck. Light a candle, play some evocative music, and think about how you respond to the cards you’ve drawn. Without looking at the meanings, what’s the first card that really resonates with you? What plant strikes a chord in you on first sight? 
 After you know the deck a bit better, it’s ready for use. Plants have always been a foundational part of how we treat our bodies, and Tarot can be a tool to help sort our thoughts. Consider drawing a card in the morning to guide you throughout the day. Ponder a question and draw three cards to meditate on the foundation of a problem, what it looks like currently, and how to handle it in the future. Or lay out a full ten-card spread and really get to the root of it all. 
Here is a small sampling of the cards included in the deck, with notes from their creator.


THE LOVERS represents emotional decisions and the union between independent and equal partners. I chose peonies because they have flamboyant blooms that are "perfect flowers" -- a botanical term for flowers with both reproductive parts --  and for the generosity they exhibit in their symbiotic relationship with ants. I think it’s important for modern decks to capture the essence of The Lovers, and for me it’s about people being their whole selves and sharing that with others, the way peonies share their dew with ants and are protected from predators in turn.
 Like the floating seeds of a dandelion, THE FOOL sets out on their journey full of hope and with the promise of new growth. It’s a common plant, almost ubiquitous, and carries with it a naive quality I find appealing - I love the idea of making a wish by blowing on its seeds.
Tarot is sometimes described as the journey of the Fool through the deck. That’s why I picked a weed that could weather all of that and still come out on the other side with a feeling of charm and whimsy to be the major symbol of Botanica.
THE SEVEN OF WANDS is represented by Datura, or Thorn Apple -- a highly poisonous species of flowering shrubs pollinated by bats. I picked it for this card because the Seven of Wands is about being ready for a battle and having the endurance to see it through, and the fruit of datura reputedly have the ability to heal wounds as much as they can cause harm.
I picked Japanese vajra (a Buddhist ritual object) for the wands because they’re a symbol of enlightenment that embodies the balance between the five poisons to one’s purity and the five wisdoms that help one attain it.

THE FOUR OF COINS is a card is about being trapped by comfort. Honeysuckle bears flowers with a sweet aroma that wafts through the summer air, attracting all manner of creatures. It can be an extremely invasive species, and in those cases its vines can take over native plants and literally choke them. The Four of Coins is a warning to avoid excess, to take time to smell the flowers.
The coin symbol I picked for this card is wampum, a beaded Native American currency, as the Common Honeysuckle is a species native to the eastern coast of North America. The shells of this protocurrency were harvested off the coast and prized as much for their value as decoration. Their beautiful swirls of purple and white were often woven into belts by tribes like the Iroquois.
 Here are the  three editions in which we're publishing BOTANICA.

The standard BOTANICA deck will include all 78 cards, and a booklet explaining the symbolic meaning of each card and each plant. Each deck comes in a sturdy tuckbox, blocked with gold foil.  Everything you need to read fortunes in the flowers.
 ***SOLD OUT***
THE ALCHEMIST is a collectible version of BOTANICA, limited to an edition of two hundred fifty. This edition is housed in an elaborately embossed tin with antique brass finishing, wrapped in the embroidered silk altar cloth. Each copy is signed and hand-numbered by the artist Kevin Jay Stanton. You will be thanked by name in the informational booklet that accompanies the deck.
THE ALTAR CLOTH
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions include a 24x24" silk altar cloth to be used for readings (or as a stylish neckerchief). In addition to being a beautiful way to encase your deck, each cloth is embroidered with symbols of the Arcana and imbued with the wishfulness and tenacity of dandelions.
THE COMPENDIUM
The ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST, ENCHANTER and HERBALIST AND COMPENDIUM tiers will come with a a compendium detailing the research, process art and theory that went into the creation of BOTANICA. THE COMPENDIUM is 96 pgs, roughly 4.5 x6.25", blocked with gold foil on the cover. If you wish to add the book (or an extra book) on to any existing order, just add $20 to any US order or $30 to any international order.  (NOTE: a digital PDF edition of the book will be included with all versions of the deck, as well as the A GLIMPSE and A READING tiers.)
THE DANDELION PIN
A 1" hard enamel dandelion pin, to be included with all ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions, as it's own rewards tier and add-on. If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.
THE EGLANTINE PIN
A 1" hard enamel eglantine pin, to be included with all ALCHEMIST, DARK ALCHEMIST and ENCHANTER editions, as it's own rewards tier and add-on. If you'd like to add on a pin to an existing order, just add $18 to any US order, $25 to any Canadian order, or $30 to any other international order. You'll be able to select the pin as a bonus through BackerKit later, when answering your shipping survey.
THE DARK ALCHEMIST  is housed in an elaborately embossed tin with black finishing, wrapped in a silk altar cloth.  It comes with a booklet explaining the symbolic meaning of each card and each plant, as will as digital access to to a DRM-free PDF. Your name will be printed in the booklet in acknowledgement of your support of this project.
STRETCH GOAL UPDATE: IN ADDITION TO THE DECK AND TIN, THE DARK ALCHEMIST NOW INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING ITEMS:
THE ALTAR CLOTH
THE COMPENDIUM (Hardcover and digital editions)
FOUR BONUS TAROT-SIZED POSTCARDS
THE DANDELION ENAMEL PIN
THE EGLANTINE ENAMEL PIN
THE ENCHANTER, the rarest and most sorcerous edition of BOTANICA, is housed in a glass jewel box, which itself lives inside a 13" two-tier terrarium fashioned of glass and golden brass. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As the veterans of a dozen fully funded and fulfilled Kickstarter campaigns, Beehive Books founders Josh O’Neill and Maëlle Doliveux know well the challenges associated with funding, printing, and distributing beautiful oversized art books. Between our various ventures, we have raised nearly a million dollars on Kickstarter, and rewarded backers of every campaign with many beautiful books and other rewards.

We've carefully priced out expenses for domestic and overseas shipping, as well as printing costs for all rewards. We’ve arranged for the logistics of reward fulfillment. We know exactly how much money and how much work are required to get this project across the finish line. All we need is the funding necessary to finish the job. To be honest, our biggest risk is that in these turbulent times people won't have the funds to spend on art projects like these.

Still, there are more risks and challenges involved in making things with such high production values than I can realistically list here. Don't believe anybody who tells you this stuff is easy. Problems can and will pop up in ways we can't predict. (For instance, despite our considerable epidemiological expertise, we didn't see this global pandemic coming.) But our team has the knowledge, experience and commitment to persevere through difficulties and deliver a product that meets and exceeds the exacting expectations of our audience of discerning readers and collectors.

campaign.story:
WHAT IS THE STRAIGHTS?
The Straights is an epic road-trip play about desire and distance in 2017 America. The play follows 20-to-30-something best buds Phoebe and Nina as they navigate hitchhikers, shoplifting, drugs, and a flood of selfies on a cross-country no-boys-allowed adventure through the heart and heartlessness of the USA. 
The Straights is also a investigation of the role road-trip narratives have traditionally played in building a predominantly straight-white-cis-male American cultural mythology. Utilizing both video and live performance, the play aggressively dismantles traditional American mythology through a narrative framework which centers women, queer folx, non-human persons, and people of color as the primary subjects of the American democratic experiment.   
There's more info here: https://www.thestraightstheplay.com

WHY IS THE STRAIGHTS?
T. Says:
I began writing this play shortly after Donald Trump's inauguration in 2017. Like probably most people reading this page, I find myself continually disgusted and alienated by Trump's vision of the United States. Attempting to understand how Trump was both an aberration and continuity in the history of American self-image, I started reading tons of "classic" American narratives- the ones I was supposed to read in high school English class and never did- attempting to understand how this man and his followers saw America so differently from the way I see it and the way I wish to see it. 
I read On the Road. I read The Grapes of Wrath. I read Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas. I read Democracy in America and Huckleberry Finn and The Electric Kool-Aid Acid Test and watched Easy Rider and read Lolita and watched that movie where Britney Spears meets her mom and sings "I'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A Woman". You probably already surmised that all these narratives are about young straight white twenty-something cis-males finding themselves and the American dream out on the open road (except for the Britney Spears one). I'll be the first to admit, my reading list definitely had some gaps it which were my own fault and the fault of my research; but repeatedly centering these narratives on the same type of person also reflects a massive failure of imagination from these writers. I thought, "Why do only these men get to go on road-trips and find themselves and live by their own rules and define what America looks and feels like?"
The Straights is my humble attempt to tell a story about this country's identity that centers queer folx, femme people, non-human persons, and people of color, rather than people who look like me. It asks what a truly inclusive democracy might look and functional like. It challenges accepted notions of who fundamental U.S. values of freedom and independence might serve to protect, and what the consequences of such a value system might be. It's a play about how I felt on Inauguration Day 2017 and how I hope we will all feel on Inauguration Day 2021. I'm so honored and excited to share it with you.

campaign.story:
This American Blood was founded with this simple question in mind, coupled with the notion that you can be something more than just your military service. Time in uniform plays a major role in shaping our identities, but it can also very easily consume them𑁋especially with how we outwardly display ourselves. This led us to examine what has become a major area of veteran culture and creative output:
Apparel.
The clothing we choose to wear has a way of speaking to those around us.
Are your clothes sending the right message, or are they talking a bit too much?
There is no shortage of veteran apparel brands, yet for all their numbers, there is a surprising lack of variance between their designs, style, and the messages they hold. The military identity is pushed blatantly to the forefront, often in a manner that appears purposefully alienating and even belittling to fellow Americans. While intended to celebrate being a veteran, this sort of clothing ironically reinforces many of the negative stigmas and stereotypes that run rampant in our community and public opinion.
TAB Seal shirt back, gray
This American Blood seeks to serve as an alternative to the current veteran lifestyle brand status quo. Many veterans and their supporters enjoy the idea of apparel inspired by patriotism and military culture, but find the available options glaring or distasteful. Our approach is to provide apparel with subtle yet stylish designs centered on a humble sense of pride in country, service, and self.
We want to be something more than just a clothing company𑁋we want to be a creative outlet with a cause. Our mission includes providing veteran artists with an opportunity to display their talent and share their own story, with apparel serving as a canvas.
TAB Seal breakdown
For this campaign, there are two products from our catalog that are up for grabs. You may have noticed the shirt in our video is different from the one pictured below. Since we filmed the video, we have altered the designs based off the feedback of our earliest supporters. **The designs pictured below are what you will be receiving**
The TAB Seal shirt, gray
Our Seal design is printed on a high-quality heather gray shirt made with a 60/40 blend of cotton and polyester, combining softness and comfort with the durability to maintain its fit and feel with consistent wear. Offered in sizes from XS-XXL. 
TAB Seal shirt front, gray
TAB Seal shirt back, gray
The TAB Leaf logo snapback trucker hat, with a tri-color pattern 
Our tri-color Oak Leaf snapback trucker hat utilizes 3D puff embroidery instead of a cheaper flat stitching method, enhancing the shape and style of the design.
TAB tri-color trucker hat
Community is important to us, and we have made it a priority to reflect this in our manufacturing process. All products are printed and embroidered locally by small businesses in the San Diego area. 
We want to be a company that serves veterans who may feel disconnected from the more mainstream brands. Kickstarter provides an all inclusive platform to introduce ourselves to the world, share our mindset and values, and display what we are creating. With this platform we can gauge interest from our peers and everyday patriotic Americans that support them.
With the funds we raise from this initial campaign we will be able to bring the rest of our catalog to life. Our goal is to offer more than just apparel by providing a creative outlet to veterans, and support from people like you will help us get there. 
Many bonds are formed through military service, and that is where the story behind This American Blood begins. The three of us met while serving together in the Marine Corps, and we have remained close friends ever since. Reflecting on our own experiences since hanging up the uniform is what inspired us to look outward at the larger cultural meaning of being a veteran. To learn more, visit our website.
Ryan, Jose, and Dan; the TAB team

campaign.story:
Aura Wisp is a patent pending single-use smudge pod.
Intended to provide a means of practicing the sacred act of smudging that is respectfully adapted to healing in today's reality. 
Smudging is the act of burning sacred herbs to cleanse the energy of spaces, people, animals, and objects, which was practiced by many indigenous people, including my Native American ancestors.  
Handmade. Organic. Sustainably-harvested. Reiki-infused. Compostable.
Closeup of Aura Wisp featuring Alyssia (that's me!). Taken by @qdog69. Check him out on IG!
Each reiki-infused Aura Wisp smudge pod is handmade with: 
Organic dehydrated hemp paper
Sustainably-harvested, certified organic white sage
Vegan natural glue
Integrity, unconditional love, and respect 
Lovingly handcrafted in small batches with the highest intentions by 3lements for Growth.
Video: Alyssia lovingly hand-twisting an Aura Wisp smudge pod. Music by @izzhe_realight, recorded at the feminine energy vortex of Cathedral Rock, Sedona, AZ. 
Mindfully light & burn your Aura Wisp to:
better unwind, destress, and relax at the end of your day
reset your energy after yoga or any other healing practice
aid in a better night's sleep
set the space for meditation
clear your energy in between appointments, meetings, and/or clients
cleanse your new home, car, or space
find a moment of peace when feeling anxious
cleanse your space after having company over
cleanse the energy inside your hotel room or Airbnb while traveling
energetically support yourself during and after a life transition
better come back to your center after being around any number of people 
cleanse the energy in your home in between each month or season
aid in preparation for each Full and New Moon
assist you through any practice that helps facilitate your sense of peace, relaxation, healing, and being present.
Each Aura Wisp tin contains:
20 Aura Wisp smudge pods
6" vegan hemp wick
1 round tin container
You can keep your Aura Wisp smudge pod tin in your bag, purse, backpack, glove compartment, drawers, or anywhere that's convenient!
Easy to travel with and great as a gift! 
The (dia) 2.5" x 0.5" sample container in the above images is for size reference only.
 Back my project to claim your VERY OWN first batch Aura Wisp tin! 
The 6" vegan hemp wick allows you to ignite your Aura Wisp smudge pod without altering the beautiful aroma of the sacred herbs, which is common when using a butane lighter.  
The round tin container is meant to easily store and carry around your Aura Wisp smudge pods, as well as provide a suitable option to ash them when needed. 
Each Aura Wisp tin contains 20 smudge pods.
Our first line features the only certified organic* white sage in the United States, which we infuse with high-vibrational reiki energy as we lovingly and intentionally hand-twist each Aura Wisp.
This is the most beautifully fragrant white sage I have ever experienced!
Stay tuned for the video of my visit to Sage Winds Farm, where I had the opportunity to do energy work with the source of our white sage. I also got to connect with the remarkable and kickass steward of the land, Ellen, and the animals who watch over it.   
Image of certified organic white sage at Sage Winds Farm by Brie Watson from Hipcamp.com.
* Certified organic by the USDA and CCOF. 
Screenshot of Sage Winds Farm in the USDA Organic Integrity Database.
 Deeply connecting and building a relationship with the sacred herbs that we source and the land on which they are grown is of the highest importance to me.  
This is why I promise to personally visit and work on each farm that we support through our products. With my background in the farmers' market industry and as an urban farmer, combined with my work as an energy healer and shamanic practitioner-in-training, I have a deep understanding of what sustainable agriculture and tending to Mama Earth look like. 
You can trust that you are always supporting the best and most high-vibrational practices with your purchase. 
Because we will only source sustainably-harvested and in-season sacred herbs, we consider Aura Wisp to be small batch. This is because we want to only harvest an amount that maintains a respectful relationship with the plant, the land on which its grown, and the hands that tend to them and through which they pass. 
Close your eyes... Take a deep breath... Set your intention... Then light it up! 
Easily maneuver your Aura Wisp by its tail so that the smoke from the sacred herbs can blanket you, your space, or whatever needs energetic cleansing. Take this moment to breathe, to be as present as you can, and to express gratitude for all of the abundance and blessings that are in your life. 
Mindfully refill your space with high-vibrational, loving, healing energies that resonate with your Greatest Good and your Highest Self!  
To extinguish your Aura Wisp, allow the smudge pod to continue filling your space with smoke until the sacred herbs self-extinguish, or simply stomp out the embers.    
In the above video, I demonstrate how I use my Aura Wisp to thoroughly cleanse my chakras from "any negative energies, energies that are not my own, or energies that do not serve my Greatest Good." I try to do this every evening to ensure that I remain as centered and balanced as possible. As an empath, it's super easy for me to take on the energies of situations, places, and others, but this practice has helped me better identify which energies are truly my own. 
How you specifically choose to practice smudging with your Aura Wisp is lead and developed by your intuition, but this is a great place to start!    
Aura Wisp is made for single-use and is much more compact than a traditional smudge stick, averaging at 2.2" x 0.5". Its size makes it convenient to use and take on-the-go. 
Sitting in stress, frustration, commotion, sadness, anger, guilt, shame, anxiety, or any other low-vibrational feeling until you get home is incredibly draining on your energy. The convenience of Aura Wisp empowers you to transform your day by cleansing and neutralizing any energies that are not serving your Highest Good sooner rather than later.   
(Left) Comparison of Aura Wisp with a traditional smudge stick. (Right) Sketch of Aura Wisp.
Aura Wisp's compact size decreases the surface area of the burning sacred herbs, which results in the release of an ideal amount of smoke for personal use. Its size also minimizes the amount of ash and the potential of falling burning pieces while smudging. 
The sacred herbs inside Aura Wisp burn and smoke with the embers left after blowing out the flame used to ignite the smudge pod. Once the sacred herbs are done burning, the smudge pod typically self-extinguishes in the ash remaining in the pod.
(Left) Aura Wisp. (Right) The completely compostable remnants of your Aura Wisp after smudging.
Lastly, Aura Wisp is completely compostable, as the entire thing is essentially a leaf! You can add whatever is left of your Aura Wisp to your compost pile or let it free outside with the other leaves once you are done smudging. Be sure to double check that the pod is fully extinguished beforehand!
My initial goal for this Kickstarter is $33,333, which will allow for my future team and I to turn 1/4th of our current certified organic white sage harvest into Aura Wisp smudge pods. 
*~ My fully funded minimum goal is $144,444. ~*
This will allow my future team and I to process our entire first batch of 111 pounds of sustainably harvested white sage, which has already been cured and is now waiting to be lovingly hand-twisted into smudge pods. 
Our fully funded minimum goal of $144,444 will enable us to handmake and ship 8,111 Aura Wisp tins (a.k.a. 162,220 smudge pods), including vegan hemp wick and eco-friendly shipping materials. 
With the money raised, I intend to hire at least five certified reiki practitioners or lightworkers for 6 months (with the possibility for extension) to hand-twist each Aura Wisp. Together, we will ensure that there remains a high consciousness around the energy being transferred to you through your smudge pods.
The fully funded minimum goal will also allow me to cover the investment that went into making this first batch a reality and will enable me to pay my own living expense while developing the structure and system to fulfill your orders.
If we exceed our fully funded minimum goal and can reach $188,888, I intend to hire a Marketing Manager as well as an Accessibility Manager, who will ensure that all of our content across all platforms is appropriately captioned and interpreted as needed. Together, we will create content to share the lessons that we have learned through our experience and understanding of healing in today's reality. 
*~ My dream minimum goal is $255,555. ~* 
This would greatly empower me to do all of the above and secure a suitable home and work/healing space for us to come together to handcraft each Aura Wisp. 
Manifest, manifest, manifest!
If you love what we are doing and feel called to support more, please feel free to add to your pledge amount 🙏🏼
I also have a background in farmers' markets, food justice, urban farming, public health, and community engagement. 
You can learn more about me here (website) and here (LinkedIn). 
Screenshot from Oakland Food Policy Council's website.
Creating a product that allows me to combine my passion for sustainable, local agriculture with my love for the healing arts has truly been a blessing. 
I'm geeking out so hard about this project! 
My wonderful harvests and I.
Also, I regularly work with an intuitive massage therapist and reiki practitioner, a hypnotherapist, an acupuncturist, shamans, and various other healers to constantly help facilitate my own healing so that I may better serve YOU, the world, and my Divine Purpose.
From the bottom of my heart, I deeply appreciate and love you for sharing space, time, and energy with me and my Aura Wisp smudge pods.
Sending you so much love and light!
Cheers,
Alyssia Michelle Plata

campaign.story:
G R O W is a children's book that parents and kids will love — teaching a true life principle encapsulated within the idea of not wishing for an easy life, but for the strength to endure your own.
   G R O W will be printed on 100% recycled/tree-free paper and is partnered with Arbor Day Foundation where with every book sold, a tree is planted — helping reduce deforestation.
This isn’t just a children’s book; It’s a story about us.
We have lived through the principles illustrated in this book, tested their merits, and have found them to be true.
In 2017, our family suffered the traumatic and tragic death of a brother and friend. Twelve hours after the funeral, we delivered our baby into the world with no time for meds or a doctor; We were fired then lost all of our money; Our new baby was hospitalized with pneumonia; We started a business then watched it burn; We faced buried psychological pain from childhood trauma. After all of that, what proved to be one of the hardest trials was the anger, mental anguish, and denial born out of an inability to accept that so many things could go wrong in such a short time.
Sometimes we are planted in unbelievably difficult situations. But rather than run from them —rather than dream that they don’t exist —we should face our own personal storms and find a way to grow because of them. When we started this project we were at rock bottom, so we decided to make our message. 
Everyone goes through hard times. It is our hope that this principle of growing can help you and your children as much as it has helped us and ours.
It’s not about where you are planted but how you grow. If you are going through something difficult you can’t change the trial, but you can change what you do about it. Life challenges your resolve; it pushes your limits and it tests your strength. With every action there is an equal and opposite reaction: If you are trying to improve it will hurt — That is literally the most natural thing that could happen. But you can take it. If you just keep growing, we promise you will come out on top.
Our message is one we learned at the start of our family’s crazy season of storms. After facing the death of someone’s bright, beautiful light — the sun set. As the sun rose again, we saw the beginning of life while we welcomed our baby girl into the world whose nickname brought this message all the way home for us: “LIV." With life comes pain; with pain comes growth; With growth comes grit; with grit comes results.
Thank you for taking the time to read about our story. We hope you and your little ones find it to be something special.
Love, 
 Us
We need your help to bring this book to life. We didn’t publish the traditional way because we wouldn’t have been able do what we felt was right. We know what it’s like when money is so tight that you have to search for all the quarters in your house so you can buy milk for your kids . . . So we know how much of a sacrifice $20 for a children’s book can be — thank you!
If you’re the kind of parent that wants to inspire their kids in an honest way — to teach them how to accept hard things and to find the path to growth — then we promise you will love this book.
We love collaborating with inspiring people and we are excited to call you our friends. We hope this book will encourage you and your little ones and hope it will be something special to lean on during your own seasons of growing.
—Dave & Natalie
Follow G R O W on Instagram: @grow.thebook
Dave Swenson: @dave.swenson
Natalie Swenson: @natalie.swenson
Karly Jade Catto: @karlyjadec

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project comes with its own unique risks and challenges. Our book is still in the works, but it's 99% finished with a few small alterations to make it perfect. It's taken a lot to get this project in front of you, with facing so many roadblocks—like having our previous illustrator drop our book after 6 months of work, and finding our new amazing illustrator a month before launch date, and then having to find a new printer that honors completely Tree Free/100% recycled options. The challenges getting this book to you has been another reminder of the message of this book to persevere through the hard times.

Our number one priority is getting this book to you as soon as we can. Our illustrator is working wonders bringing our book to life, and because printing completely Tree Free/100% recycled books doesn't happen overnight, we appreciate the understanding and patience of our backers during the printing process. We hope to have the rewards ASAP, but it could be delayed due to unforeseen circumstances due to shipping delays, printing issues, etc. We anticipate getting your book in your hands by October.

campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Iris Knightley and I’m the author of The Three Brotherteers. I am the mother of three wonderful young boys, Barris, Kensington and Zachary. My oldest son Barris was diagnosed with autism at the age of three; Barris is non-verbal and unable to read or write. One afternoon, I was watching my children play with each other and I was simply amazed by how autism isn’t a factor in their interactions with one another. My children simply see Barris for who he is; they don’t see him by his autistic label. 
 Our journey as a family inspired me to write my book, The Three Brotherteers. I decided to take a pen to paper and write a vivacious and classic story of three young brothers who go on an adventurous journey, as they race about outside on a chilly autumn evening, where the family dog and the frisky squirrels are transformed into characters within their topsy-turvy escapades. Autism doesn’t play a role in the storyline; it’s about the character’s natural ability to engage in social acceptance. 
In today’s technology-driven culture, computers, tablets and smartphones often replace the good ‘ol days of hide and seek, climbing trees and playing a game of tag. Disconnecting from everyday technology and encouraging my children to engage with their imagination has helped them embrace their brother Barris, regardless of his autism. The story of The Three Brotherteers brings to life children’s ability to use their imagination, create their own stories and relate with one another. 
I decided to launch this Kickstarter to share The Three Brotherteers with all of you. With your support, I’ll be able to self-publish my book. For every $20 pledge, you’ll receive an advance copy of The Three Brotherteers before it’s released to the general public in January 2018. For every $35 pledge, you’ll receive an advance copy of my book plus special edition posters of The Three Brotherteers characters included. 
This book is my opportunity to communicate with others about autism and share the positive experiences that can be created for children, especially those who are autistic. I want my readers to learn that children with autism are capable of meaningful communication. Others must learn to believe that they are capable of living a fulfilling life through various activities like play therapy. 
I hope you’re inspired to help me in two ways: one, please share this Kickstarter with your friends on social media, including: Facebook, Instagram, or even an email. A share is priceless to the success of this campaign. And two, please make a pledge of $20 or $35 and you’ll get an advance copy of The Three Brotherteers, or even a small contribution will help us raise awareness. 
 A portion of proceeds from my book sales will benefit Good Dog! Autism Companions, a nonprofit organization dedicated to helping children and families live better lives through autism service dog companionship.

campaign.story:
You'll save hundreds, and soon thousands of dollars a year on natural household essentials as we launch more and more products every month. With Public Goods, you'll get everything you need for your home and bathroom, with zero markup.
Our mission is simple: make healthy products affordable to everyone. We were tired of the feeling at the checkout counter and the tacky bottles at drugstores, many filled with harmful chemicals. So we started our own company, launched our brand, and decided to do things differently.
How? We sell all our products to you, with zero profit! Imagine that. We only charge a small monthly membership fee.
The result is that we can deliver premium products at literally half the price of everyone else, saving you potentially thousands of dollars per year. And on Kickstarter only, we're offering a lifetime membership for a single, one time fee. Once you become a member, you can choose which items you want from our line of natural products and get them at cost.
Savings aside, what matters most are the quality of our products. We began with obsessive formulations, vetted by the most discerning people we know. It took us over a year. We visited over 100 skincare labs. We consulted with experts. Hired the most reputable chemists. And we think you will really like the result: healthy products, naturally scented, cleanly designed and packaged.
In our line of premium natural products you’ll find: 
shampoo 
hand soap
bar soap
conditioner
moisturizer
body wash
shaving cream
razors
deodorant
toothpaste
toothbrushes
toilet paper
lip balm
sunscreen
And we're going to be launching new products every month - from natural home cleaners to biodegradable garbage bags. All our products are healthy, cruelty free, and contain natural fragrance only.
And, we're not stopping with products for the bathroom - we've already developed home cleaners. Later this year we're launching linens. Next year, groceries - all premium, and all at a fraction of the price of everyone else.
And just like we want our products to be kind to you, we also want them to be kind to the environment. We use bioplastics in our packaging, and are always striving to be more eco-friendly. By keeping things local and making our products here in the U.S, we're also keeping our carbon footprint down.
As a thank you to our early supporters, we're offering you an amazing deal. This campaign will be the only time you'll be able to get a lifetime membership. Anyone who joins after the campaign, will choose from a monthly or annual fee. Here's an example of savings.
Our company was co-founded by Morgan Hirsh and Michael Ferchak. And, our lead product advisor is Kim Greenfeld of Trader Joe's and Wholefoods.
Morgan studied philosophy at Concordia. Before Public Goods he ran one of the largest luxury leather goods manufacturers in North America, developing and producing products for top brands such as Ralph Lauren, Saks Fifth Avenue, and Barney's. With an eye for fashion and a nose for quality, Morgan is an expert product developer, while still being grounded in the nitty gritty of manufacturing. Morgan is an avid tennis player and an amateur magician.
Michael, our COO, studied engineering and Chinese at Dartmouth. Living abroad for over a decade, he became a specialist in product packaging. From sourcing to manufacturing to product testing, he built a wholesale packaging company from scratch that now makes millions in sales. He doesn't like when things don't work, so fixes them obsessively. His college friends remember when he rebuilt a car after it had been through an electrical fire… nobody thought he could do it. He did it.
Kim Greenfeld is a dedicated foodie, and the founder of Campo Verde Solutions, a consulting firm specialising in the organic and natural food industry. Kim has spent over 20 years at retail companies such as Trader Joe's and Whole Foods Markets, and her resume is pretty impressive: when working as the Coordinator of Buying at Trader Joe's, she opened Trader Joe's East sourcing all perishable items from local East Coast vendors. And when she was at Whole Foods she introduced nearly 1000 items in a four- year period, helping Whole Foods expand and build its natural and organic private label.
With their extensive experience in producing premium goods, both Morgan and Michael grasped the inherent inefficiencies in the traditional supply chain. So, with the help of Kim's industry knowledge, they decided to fix it.
So join us today – become a member of Public Goods, and enjoy the best natural products out there at the best possible cost. We can’t wait to have you on board!
         Since 2012, Backercamp has helped make over 5,000 projects possible

My Background:
In May 2016 I moved to Philadelphia to get married and start my own business making a line of fun, colorful, and unique ceramic pots. After 6 years of teaching art at the university level and making pots on evenings and weekends, I was so excited for the opportunity to work in the studio full-time. I love to work with my hands and create accessibly-priced pieces of art that make people happy. The response to this line of ceramics has been remarkable, and I can't wait to see where the business will go next.  
Krista (my wife) and I taking a break outside of our current studio in Port Richmond
 My Challenge:
After almost one year of operating out of a studio in the Port Richmond neighborhood in Philadelphia, we have outgrown the space and are now facing an important challenge. In order to take the next step in our business, we need to upgrade to a larger and better-equipped facility that will help us increase production and allow for better visibility and engagement with the public. We recently found an amazing space at the Globe Dye Works, a beautiful converted factory building located in the Frankford neighborhood. This space offers some significant upgrades from my current studio including brand a new electrical system, HVAC, windows + skylights. Most importantly, the Globe Dye Works building is home for many creative small-businesses which provides a great sense of community and potential for networking.
New studio space under construction at Globe Dye Works
My Goal:
In order to move in to a new space and start producing right away, I need to buy a few pieces of new equipment and build some new studio furniture. The most important investment is 3 new electric kilns, which are essential in the production of ceramics.  I am looking to purchase 3 Skutt KM-1227 kilns from The Ceramic Shop, a Philadelphia-based ceramic supply company. Each of these kilns costs $2,844.00 and should last for at least 10-15 years of regular firing. In addition to the kilns, I am seeking $1,500 for materials to build tables, carts, a storage system, and a structure for displaying finished work.  Lastly, I would like to hire and train local artists through an assistantship and internship program, offering them fair wages for their work, which I would be able to get off the ground with an additional $5,000 of contributions. With these updated kilns, improved efficiency, and trained assistants, I will be able to increase production volume and start accepting larger orders.
Skutt KM-1227 electric kiln

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks involved with the ceramic process. In our normal production, we have pieces that come out as imperfect, seconds, or sometimes completely unusable. We overcome this risk by always producing an additional 15-20% of the required pieces to account for loss. Even if the piece that you requested as a reward doesn't turn out perfectly the first time, you can trust that we will get it right for you. After all, we're professionals!

In the case of an overwhelming response to a particular reward level, or the campaign as a whole (woo!!!) we may need to extend the fulfillment / delivery times slightly for some recipients. Our pots require a lot of handwork and individual attention, so it takes several weeks for them to go through the entire process.

We created the Fidgi Pen originally to relieve the stress of work and school. The more research we did, the more we understood how prevalent fidgeting was in the world. We also realized this product would benefit those who have ADD, ADHD and autism by helping them channel their fidgeting into a useful and discreet toy.
We have put together a project that we know will promote good in the world and we are so excited to share it with you! The Fidgi Pen has a Patent Pending with its one of a kind unique design. 
The Fidgi Pen is the most discreet fidget toy out there. One of a kind in design and original by nature. The functionality of a pen mixed with the features of a fidget toy make Fidgi Pen the hottest item on the market.
                Backers get a free gift for sharing! Every backer that shares this project on their social media will receive 2 free ink refills with their pledge.  Simply message us the link that you shared and we will add the ink refills to your pledge. Help spread the word out to the fidgeting world!
                                     Do you know how to use a pen? Then you are qualified to use the Fidgi Pen. Can you turn on a light switch? Qualified. Roll a copper ball? Qualified. 
Click Switch feature
    Rolling Ball feature
  We included these specific features as we researched what were the most popular objects people fidgeted with. They are simply perfect.
We wanted our customers to have a product that was color coordinated with something they never leave the house without....their phones! Our colors of Black (Stealth), White (Snow), Gray (Slate) and Rose Gold were the 4 most popular cell phone colors in 2016.
             Spin Disk feature
    Flip Clip feature

The Stealth comes in black with a steel ball and steel spin top
The Snow comes in white with a steel ball and steel spin top
The Slate comes in gray with a steel ball and steel spin top
The Rose Gold comes in rose gold with a copper ball and copper spin top
          Our limited edition Kickstarter color scheme will available when we reach $100,000!
                                            Are you stressed at work or bored at school? The Fidgi Pen allows you to channel your focus and stay on task. It will relieve that stress from work and help you make it through class. Meanwhile, no one around you will even know you are fidgeting.
Can fidgeting help YOU? Of course fidgeting can help you! But don't only take this from us, let's look at the cold hard facts. Many people have used other things to fidget with and we believe that if you have a more discreet fidget toy that you will be able to fidget more without distracting others.

The Science Of Why We Fidget While We Work

Always Fidgeting? Well, you just might be doing yourself a world of good
Why Fidgeting Is Not As Bad As You Thought
New Study Suggests Movement Helps ADHD Students Learn

Yes.

No. It's for everyone!

Braydon is the main videographer and photographer for many well known nation wide companies and can grow a fabulous beard.

campaign.story:
______________________________________________________________________
If you missed out on joining this project and would like to get your hands on a Ti Pocket Pro, they will be available for pre-order from our websites and will ship out shortly after all the Kickstarter rewards.
USA Orders - bigidesign.com
INTL Orders - bigidesign.co
______________________________________________________________________
Hi Kickstarters,
We are thrilled to finally introduce the Ti Pocket Pro.
It's our most innovative EDC (everyday carry) pocket pen yet!
A Pen That Completely Changes The Rules
Since 2011, we've been focused on innovating and redesigning EDC products to be more versatile and open up better options for people. We love creating purposeful everyday carry items that are built for life, change the rules, and challenge the industry expectations for the better.
The Ti Pocket Pro is the only pen that can seamlessly telescope to accommodate 80+ different refills without any guesswork, gaps, hacks, modifications, spacers, or tip-wiggle. It's seemingly effortless ability to transform in length to perfectly fit both parker-style ballpoint refills and standard rollerball refills without any visible gaps or hacks makes it a pen without peers.
Ti Pocket Pro automatically adjusts to 80+ refills without visual body gaps or tip wiggle...it's almost magic.
The same pen seamlessly transforms to accept both parker-style ballpoints & rollerball refills.

What's All The Fuss About Multiple Refills? 
The short version:
A refill is the heart of the pen and most impressions of a good/bad pen is largely due to the quality ink and refill inside. So, being able to effortlessly swap out refills at will, (or when one manufacture goes out of business) allows you to control how your pen writes, and keep your pen alive for generations.
The long version:
We find that the majority of people typically like (or dislike) a pen based on a refill related preference. After all, the refill ink and tip design is what largely contributes to the dry time, line consistency, and how/if the ink will even stick to certain paper types.

The majority of mass-market pens (regardless of price) will lock you into buy their proprietary refill, forcing you to buy a new pen if you want to use another brand or refill inside.
So, being able to swap out 80+ popular refills without any headache, spacers, or hacks allows you to keep a grade 5 titanium pen body for a lifetime. You can literately pass down a functional piece of family history to future generations that helped record yours.
Compact EDC Pocket Pen - Grade 5 Titanium Construction
The Perfect Fit...Every Time. 
Our patent pending design allows the Ti Pocket Pro to perfectly adjust to the size of the refill with ease without any visual gaps, making over 80+ refills look and feel like they were each custom made for the pen.
Finally, a pen that works seamlessly with both ballpoint and rollerball refills.

Auto-Adjusting Collet 
Refill tip diameters vary from one manufacture to the next. So, if you want a versatile machined pen that can accept multiple refill brands, you're typically stuck with an oversized pen tip opening and a refill that wiggles/jiggles/rattles around while writing. It can be pretty annoying and noisy in quiet environments. 
Our patent pending design implements an auto-adjusting collet at the front of the pen tip to minimize any gaps and variances that cause the tip to wiggle. The end result is a snug fitting pen tip that feel like it was custom made for the tip.
Automatically adjusts to your refill, everytime.
Auto-adjusting collet helps eliminate "tip-wiggle" on various refill diameters.
Deep Carry Titanium Pocket Clip 
The sturdy, deep-carry pocket clips are made from solid grade 4 titanium to supply the proper tension and allow the pen to stay firmly in place. We designed these pens for the long-haul, so our pocket clips can be easily repaired/reshaped using a common flat head screwdriver if you ever accidentally snag or bend it. Easy-breezy.
Deep Carry Titanium Pocket Clip
Compact Size + Comfortable Grip
Visual comparison with a ballpoint refill (left) and a rollerball refill (right).
Even at it's longest, the pen is shorter than a permanent marker and G2. The grip section is nearly identical in diameter to a G2 and body of a permanent marker. Providing a solid and comfortable gripping surface that's very familiar.
Pen tip/grip diameter compared to a Pilot G2 pen.
A visual comparison of pens having the same Pilot G2 refill inside.

80+ Compatible Refills...You've Got Options! 
Most pens on the EDC market fall into two refill types, ballpoint refills or rollerball refills. The Ti Pocket Pro completely changes the game and plays well with both styles.
Ballpoint Refills List 
Ballpoint refills are known for their toughness and their oil based inks that adhere to a large variety of papers and surfaces.

campaign.story:
Last year we introduced BULLET: World's Smallest LED Flashlight. We are back again, now with an even more minimal design, inspired by the iconic 40 S&W round. 
Introducing BULLET 02: World's Smallest LED Flashlight, Even Smaller.
  We wanted to create something better and solve all the issues that the first Bullet faced. So we went back to the drawing board and started a complete redesign. 
The uber minimal design makes it even smaller than it's counterpart. BULLET 02 can be attached to virtually anything. Your gym bag, your jacket, your keys. Suitable for any indoor or outdoor situation.
    We believe that your everyday carry essentials are a reflection of you and your lifestyle. BULLET 02 not only is functional, beautiful and minimal, but its new design makes it the best, most resistant everyday carry tiny LED flashlight available.
BULLET 02 will feature a quick 180 degree rotation that is spring locked for secure on/off operation. The Bullet 02 will not unlatch even under the most vigorous conditions. 
  Pushing the boundaries was our goal- How can we make BULLET better? Waterproof. More minimal. More secure. Smaller. Brighter. And most important of all, indestructible.
Available in Matte Gunmetal
  Matte Black and Matte Brass
      We designed Bullet 02 with resistance in mind. We wanted to create a flashlight so durable, it will last in any condition and under any circumstances. We even ran over it with an SUV.
  Designed with aerospace-grade aluminum and a sleek anodized treatment, BULLET 02 is built for any situation possible. 
Rain, sleet, hail, snow, heat and most importantly of all, water. Meaning BULLET 02 can be submerged underwater for a total of 5 minutes without any water breaching it's seals. It will illuminate in any weather and in any situation, helping you solve any problem.
Our first design wasn't enough. We came up with an even smaller design, added a spring lock mechanism to increase pressure inside of the casing. We also added a longer stem with fine threading to avoid BULLET 02 from unlatching. We combined that with premium aircraft grade aluminum alloy for a refined finish. 
Measuring in at an incredible 10mm x 26mm and weighing only 5 grams, BULLET 02 is the perfect sized flashlight for modern day wear. Powered by three LR41 Button Cell batteries to produce 20 lumens of light, keep it with you at all times, anywhere you go. 
What makes us different? We eliminate the bulk, weight, and hassle from traditional everyday carry flashlights, creating a seamless experience for you every single day.
Our competition isn't too competitive now, is it?
   One of the main features we wanted to redesign was our previous "Twist Operation". We have improved this by creating a new mechanism altogether. This time, improving the threading by making it finer and having the threading extend all the way up through the inner casing. In addition, adding a gold plated spring inside for optimal conductivity and pressure, for keeping Bullet 02 snug and sturdy at all times. 
PLAY

We wanted to keep the minimal design without unnecessary buttons to keep it slick. With the new spring lock operation, it won't ever open unintentionally.
An LED light is ideal for everyday use over a long period of time. Never worry about breaking the light, since no glass or filament is used, or replacing it, since LEDs can last a lifetime. These batteries also last much longer with LED light, saving you both time and money in the long haul.
What is an LED you ask? LED’s are the most efficient kind of light bulbs out on the market today. One small bulb can last you anywhere from 20,000 to 100,000 hours. Of course you'll still have to replace the batteries periodically. However, we decided to use a premium bulb for BULLET 02 that can last up to 150,000 hours in lifespan.
  This time we made the threads tighter, finer, and added a rubber O-ring inside the casing to create a more secure and waterproof flashlight. Also, the leverage provided by the key ring makes it easy to twist on/off. Furthermore, the triangle ring offers increased stability when on a keychain.
SPECIFICATIONS
Weight: 5 Grams
Width: 10.5 mm
Length: 26 mm
Materials: Premium Aerospace Grade Aluminum Alloy (T6061)
Battery: LR41 Button Cell
Type of bulb: LED 5mm
Special Features: Premium On/Off twist setting, and Mini Key Ring attached.
Color Options: Brass and Black
  SLUGHAUS is a small company based out of San Francisco with the sole mission of helping you stay minimal and functional. We believe that your everyday carry essentials influence your lifestyle. BULLET 02's elegance inspires innovation, while its functionality keeps you on-the-go. We hope that our products not only help keep you minimal, but help mold your lifestyle as a whole.

campaign.story:
We are eating our fleece. Every time we do laundry, our clothes shed tiny microfibers (including plastic), which go down the drains of our washing machines, through wastewater treatment facilities and into our waterways.
Everyone who wears and washes clothes is part of this pollution. Everyone who eats or breathes could suffer the consequences. Learn more about the problem of microfiber pollution here. 
This is a 120x magnified image of clothing microfibers filtered from washing machine effluent. One study found that a single fleece jacket could shed as many as 250,000 individual fibers per wash.
Our team learned about the microfiber problem while working on marine debris along the US East Coast. It became clear very quickly that this could be the biggest pollution problem facing our ocean. We knew we needed a solution, and the ocean itself helped us come up with one.
Design Inspired by Nature
Most washing machines do not have filters. The ones that do are only good to keep keys and coins from clogging your pipes. A standard filter cannot do what needs to be done: catch fibers too small for the human eye to see AND allow water flow.
So, we turned to nature. Coral does exactly what we need; it catches tiny things from flowing water.
You just drop, or throw it into your washing machine (any washing machine - front or top loaders, with and without center spindles) and do your wash as usual. It is easy to use and easy to clean.
Cora swooshes around in the laundry and just like coral, allows water to flow, while picking up those little pieces of microfiber and catching them in her stalks.
When you take it out of the washer or dryer, have a look. When you see clumps of fuzz, just pull them out and put them in the trash bin along with your dryer lint. 
This is the fuzz recovered from one load of doggie towels and blankets.
The Cora Ball was designed as an equal opportunity fiber catcher, helping you protect our public waterways from a host of potentially harmful materials and chemicals. In the US, our clothes are 60% plastic. The rest may be made from natural materials, but they are often covered in dyes, heavy metals and other chemicals. So, it makes sense to catch all of this manmade material before it ends up throughout the marine ecosystem, in the bellies of fish, and ultimately, on our plates.
We are working hard to find opportunities to upcycle or recycle the fuzz from your Cora Ball, the primary obstacle being the mixed-material nature of laundry lint (polyesters, nylons, polypropylene, cotton, wool, etc.). For now the trash is much better than the nearest river, lake or bay.
The Cora Ball will be made from 100% recycled plastic, both post-consumer and from manufacturing (would have gone to landfill). It is 100% recyclable and made in the USA (Vermont). Since we are using 100% recycled material, we have to go with whatever is out there. Most of it will be black, but every now and then, we will find a source for a color. So, the color of your Cora Ball will be a surprise of mostly black with either a clump of color or stripes.
Our design is getting the attention of industry experts, featured at innovation events and in a variety of media:
Protecting the Ocean with Each Laundry Load
This is about small collective actions having the power to achieve big results. If 10% of US households use a Cora Ball, we can keep the plastic equivalent of over 30 million water bottles from washing into our public waterways every year. That is enough water bottles to reach from New York City to London.
Your use of a Cora Ball protects both air and water. The Cora ball's design collects microfibers until you remove them and put them in the trash. That means they will not re-attach to clothing and fly off into the air - only to become run-off and end up in our public waterways anyway.
 Cora Ball Backer Rewards
As a backer, you will be first to receive your Cora Ball(s) making you an early adopter of this solution to microfiber pollution. And, you’ll get to share with friends, family and neighbors! 
Beyond the Cora, we have some additional rewards exclusive to the Kickstarter Community:
Invitation to join our Innovation Team: we want this to be the best microfiber catching device it can be, innovation team members will receive insider communications and opportunities to do specific tests and provide feedback to help us strengthen and improve our design. 
Join us on American Promise: Our work on Rozalia Project's oceanographic research vessel, American Promise, played a vital role in learning about the problem of microfiber pollution and developing a solution. She is a very special boat; a world-record holder and the greenest sailing research vessel in the world. Our top reward levels offer opportunities for a personalized tour, lunch or dinner with the captain, crew and at least one member of the Cora Ball inventor team and, at the $5,000 level, a full weekend as part of the crew working to protect the ocean on the Gulf of Maine. Read more about this extraordinary boat here and watch videos from various expeditions here.
The team behind the Cora Ball is all about ocean protection. We’ve been on the case for 7 years and it was during this work that the Cora Ball was born. 
Brooke Winslow, our Technical Designer, at work.
Not only have we developed a consumer solution to microfiber pollution, but we are working hard to better understand the problem as well. We conducted the first mountains to the sea microfiber study, sampling the entire Hudson River from the Adirondack Mountains to New York Harbor where the river meets the sea (video below) because we know that the better we understand a problem, the stronger our solution.
PLAY

This is a true social enterprise: the success of the Cora Ball first and foremost means a cleaner ocean; secondly, proceeds support Rozalia Project’s work cleaning and protecting the ocean and developing and implementing more solutions to the problem of marine debris. Learn more about Rozalia Project.
 The Technology Behind the Cora Ball
Material: Made from 100% recycled and 100% recyclable plastic in the USA.
Range of use: Useable in your washer and dryer. We've researched the high and low temperature settings in washers and dryers and selected a material that maintains its integrity within these ranges.
Effectiveness: Catches up to 35% of the microfibers per load, per Cora Ball. The effectiveness depends on several factors including what items are in the load, wash settings and wash frequency. For maximum effectiveness, we recommend using 2-3 Cora Balls. We are constantly testing to learn how it works best and will always share our results.
Limitations: The Cora Ball was designed to maximize both effectiveness and ease of use. Also, we wanted it to catch fibers from all of your clothes and textiles without having to separate. That said, we recommend that you do separate delicate items especially those with lace, tassels, crocheted sections or frayed threads, and do not wash them with your Cora Ball, as there is a chance they get caught in Cora's stalks.
Magnified (125x) image of mixed fibers on a Cora Ball after a test load. Without the Cora Ball, these would have washed out the drain, through septic systems or wastewater treatment facilities and into our public waterways.
You will make this happen: This Kickstarter Campaign is the last piece of the puzzle, rather than the first. The molds are ordered, the patents filed.
This campaign is about production: As a backer, you will support the production of Cora Balls and help us get them to market faster. Getting them to market faster means we start protecting the ocean, its creatures and ultimately all of us, faster. 
What surpassing our initial goal means to this project
Thanks to a community of amazing backers and people who will make a small effort for big collective impact, we have far surpassed our initial funding goal. We want to share what that means for the Cora Ball, the ocean and Rozalia Project, and how hitting this campaign way out of the park makes a difference.
1. It means a bigger impact protecting our ocean, lakes and rivers; the more people who have a Cora Ball, the sooner we start keeping microfiber out of our public waterways. And Kickstarter backers will get their Cora Balls first.
2. A large community of backers demonstrates support that will allow us to develop stronger relationships with distribution partners who will get the Cora Ball to a broad market.
3. Our initial $10,000 goal was the minimum it would take to go into production - this was the barest of minimums to make Cora Ball a reality - we would have been assembling them at the kitchen table. Exceeding that goal means a bigger first production run and correspondingly, a more efficient manufacturing and assembly process.
We are not going to mess around with stretch goals. We will keep spreading the word about this campaign and encourage participation. We will continue to work on streamlining our packaging and shipping plans. And we will keep in touch with you with updates as we bring the Cora Ball into the world and, together, make a difference.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge we foresee has to do with the timing of getting Cora Balls out the door, rather than with making them in the first place. We’ve tried to share a reasonable and achievable timeline for you to expect your rewards. We built in some extra time, but that could change due to unforeseen issues with manufacturing. We will keep in contact with you and share milestones as they happen. if there is a hold-up, we will explain why; if not, come July, we hope to be happily shipping Coras all over the world to get to work protecting our waterways.

As a team of scientists, educators, ship captains and ocean-lovers, we know that we don’t know everything about bringing a product to market. But, we do know about attention to detail and that not everything happens to plan (especially as sailors and field-scientists dealing with changes in the weather). So, we have added people who do know about manufacturing and products to the team, we’ve paid attention and worked hard to control the control-ables just like we would on our research vessel. And, just like when we are at sea, we will address whatever challenges we face by gathering all available information, assessing the options and making decisions, in this case, with the success of the Cora Ball, our team and our backers in mind.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: On the verge of Earth Day
updates.update_content:
Hello awesome backers,
Just as we collectively celebrate everything earth, most of which is the ocean, we are very excited to announce that all of your Cora Balls have shipped! The only exceptions are for people who have not filled out their survey and anyone with an address snafu (if you would like to check in for your tracking number, please contact us at info@coraball.com).
We are so, very grateful to all of you. Your support of our Kickstarter Campaign, your constructive feedback, your patience while we worked through the production challenges and your enthusiasm add up to big impact for our public waterways!

“Researchers find levels of plastic fibres in popular bottled water brands could be twice as high as those found in tap water.” The Guardian 14 March 2018
Microfiber pollution, especially plastic, has been making some big headlines lately. The article linked above is from the second report from Orb Media looking at plastic microfibers in our drinking water. Their research on tap water revealed the presence of plastic microfiber in tap water all over the world (). While it seemed that report would drive people to bottled water, arguably extremely bad news for our planet and ocean from a materials and consumption standpoint, this latest report underscores the need for solutions. With more microfiber in bottled water than in tap water, the need to reduce this contaminant with solutions like the Cora Ball, as well as innovations in textiles, laundry machines, laundry detergents and wastewater treatment plants is even more pressing.

Are you a Light Sleeper? Night Owl? Frequent Traveler? Napper?
Are you working crazy hours and feeling like you never have enough time to rest?
The problem we face in getting high quality, uninterrupted sleep is always the same: significant lifestyle changes.
Sleep mask can be a great solution. Just put it on, block out the light, and improve the quality of your sleep.
But, common eye masks take a one-size-fits-all approach. They don’t fit, are uncomfortable, and let light through (making it even harder to sleep).
So as industrial designers with over 10 years of experience, we made something better.
  Manta Sleep Mask is designed to upgrade your sleep & life with a personalized fit.
      Manta is the World’s 1st Modular Sleep Mask with FreeFit - so it molds to fit your unique face.
It works for 99% of all face shapes & gives you 100% blackout for your entire sleep cycle...energizing you for wherever life takes you when you wake up.
Regardless of your ethnicity, age, gender, nose shape, or preferred sleeping position, Manta’s patent-pending adjustable modular eye contours create the perfect seal - because it’s specifically tailored to you.
Side sleeper? Belly sleeper? Back sleeper?...we’ve got you covered.

Mark Webster (Authority Hacker)

Tristan King (Blackbelt Commerce)

Experience the Comfort of a Personalized Fit

Your work would improve, you’d have more energy to go out, and your body would feel stronger.
Manta Sleep Mask’s modular design, with Patent-Pending omniLAT™, offers an unprecedented level of adjustability that’s easy and intuitive to use.
Because the fit is tailored to you, there’s no extra pressure on your face.

Thanks to the 100% total blackout of the Manta Sleep Mask, you won’t experience any light leakage, meaning you’ll finally be able to sleep through the night.

Spend Less Time Sleeping & Feel More Energetic
Rapid Eye Movement (REM) sleep is when your brain is repaired and renewed.
If you need more energy and want to feel well-rested in the morning, focus on getting more REM sleep.
During REM sleep, your eyes experience rapid movements in random directions. Most sleep masks press against your face and eyes, which can interrupt this process.
Manta has specially designed eye contours that encourage REM sleep.
Because there is no direct contact or pressure on your eyelids, your REM cycle won’t be interrupted.

Thanks for checking out our Kickstarter. We're Snoice - and we aim to create an entrepreneurial, cultural, and social space in Southeast San Diego started by, and featuring, local talent.
Snoice began as a dream of Jayrell and Dianne Ringpis, who grew up in Southeast San Diego. They wanted to provide the Paradise Hills community with its first Asian-inspired dessert cafe. They began by serving traditional Filipino "halo-halo," a refreshing blend of shaved ice and various sweet toppings including ube (taro), egg custard, and toasted rice, as well as shaved snow, a light and fluffy dessert originating in Taiwan. Since then, Snoice has been featured in Zagat (twice, actually!), Eater San Diego, and various blogs. 
Check out some of our dessert offerings below, and our full menu on our website.
On our 1-year anniversary, we hosted a block party called Made in Paradise Hills.
Made in Paradise Hills was a movement sparked by an event hosted by us in 2016 to spotlight talent from the tiny neighborhood of Paradise Hills (in San Diego, California). The simple goal was to bring together the community that proudly identifies with Paradise Hills for one night. 
So what exactly happened?
About a dozen of the best artists and entrepreneurs, all of whom grew up in the area, teamed up to give back to the community. Hundreds of attendees celebrated with free entertainment, great food, and tons of giveaways. A whole parking lot proudly made noise and showed unprecedented community spirit. 
Check out the recap video below: 
PLAY

The resounding sentiment heard that evening was: "This is what the community needs."
In 2017, our next project is to give Snoice’s entire storefront a facelift and upgrade the dining area into a more versatile community space. Our goal is for the revamped Snoice to serve as a cornerstone for the future community. The revamp will allow us to comfortably host meet-ups, student workshops, movie nights, and art/music shows. 
We recently requested support from the city’s storefront improvement program, which would have granted us up to $16,000! Unfortunately, we were declined because we’re a couple blocks outside of San Diego City limits. Boo!
The Snoice storefront.
So, we need your help. We want to be able to do more, to provide not only great desserts, but a place where family, friends, and community can gather.
Double the capacity of the cafe 
Provide outdoor seating
Beautify the storefront with a new sign and landscaping
Increase wall space inside the cafe to serve as an art gallery 
Install a digital community board for announcements
Provide sound system for community events and meetings
Check out the renderings here:
Storefront, updated with new benches, planters, and outside dining area.
Interior with new lights, decorative planters, to-go window, and a television that will serve as a community board 
View from behind the front counter showing new partition at entrance/exit for utensils, napkins, and trash
Improved seating arrangement, professional signage, and decorative indoor planters
Check out all the rewards offerings we have for each donation level! 
                Keep an eye on our early bird prices (noted in the right column)! They'll be gone before you know it.
Thanks so much for reading until the end and for your support. Together, we can create a space that the community can continue to be proud of.
 Check us out on social media:
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As easy it is to dream and put concept to paper, the same cannot be said about actually purchasing and building to perfection based on the design specs we laid out. 

We've done as accurate a job of budgeting and costing as we can and included a little cushion to account for unforeseen expenses of design, furniture, equipment, installation, contractor fees, etc.

To reduce risk of non-completion, we've set two levels of budgets and designs. Our plan A accounts for what our ideal community design would be, while plan B completely satisfies a set of modest, high-priority, community-approved storefront improvements.

We have full confidence that our updates will keep the donors and community informed with each step we take in applying the funds.
