campaign.story:
To Team World, thank you for your backing. I'm sad this campaign simply didn't work out but I fully intend to rework and relaunch it in 2016. Keep http://www.smarturl.it/worldkickstarter in your Favourites and hopefully next time we'll have more success. You guys remain, as always, awesome and thank you for coming with me on this journey.
About A World of Strange New Things
In December 2014, I finished a novel and was burnt out, I wanted to write something different. This isn't new for me, normally between novels is the point where I start new projects, write short stories and detox my brain from whatever world I've been living in for the last couple of months. 
I will just write books by accident, in part because I was diagnosed with bipolar (Type 2) in December and this is the source of my prolific amount of written work. You know what? Writing really helps me.
I'd been contemplating starting my Contact novel Lesser Evils (narrated by Chaya and Josh) but it wasn't time yet (books have birthdates and times to be written) and so I started going through my existing files and decided to write something which allowed me to do the necessary worldbuilding before focusing directly on Contact but still having it in the background. 
Having Zoe as a narrator also allows me to look at things Josh and Chaya simply don't have the patience/time (him/her) to deal with in between cracking Standard, the Union's Lingua Franca and keeping their daughter away from the Bureau of Esper Affairs and Registration.
Zoe, on the other hand, she has lots of time and a habit of attracting trouble.
Concept for the omnibus cover © Scarlett Rugers
A World of Strange New Things is a serial novel set in the Ashteraiverse, it's being split into parts and everyone who backs this campaign will automatically get the first part Sweetness in Sorrow (it was also published as part of my Team Parting anthology reward Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea). 
I'm in the middle of fulfilling and finishing off my previous two Kickstarters but I like to plan ahead and lay the groundwork (plus I just cannot sit still or make my life easy). 
Serials take a lot of work and this is a pre-order campaign; the money allows me to have the campaign ready for January and will ensure a quick and organised deployment (and a lot less stress).
This Kickstarter is for the full novel, split into four parts:
Sweetness in Sorrow (free for every backer/body as a stand-alone ebook. Available when we hit 50%)
Temporal Grace (ETA: March 2016)
Suffer the Children (ETA: April 2016)
Games the Powerful Play (ETA: May 2016)
Print versions of each book will follow shortly after the ebook (they take a little bit more work) and send out to backers one at a time (unless you'd rather get them in one go, just let me know).
I don't think I'm ever going to put these print editions up for sale so this is going to be the only chance you're going to have to get them. I do however intend to release ebook versions next year (because serials are cool) however you guys get to be there, on the ground floor, of my serialised duology.
The omnibus edition A World of Strange New Things will be released in print/ebook at some point in 2016. 
It's important to note the omnibus isn't aimed at you guys, it's aimed at the Amazon market later next year but it makes sense to do one during the course of things. I'm going to offer you the ability to get a copy though, don't worry, but print will be a whole different pledge level, so that only people who actually want one will get one.
Let's get back to the story, shall we?
The Storyline
World is narrated by Zoe, a new member of the Ashterai who is trying to find her place in the universe. She starts off as a healer, a celestial EMT, wandering the universe helping where she can, but soon (after a particularly horrific incident on a Chiitai battlefield) requests reassignment and becomes a personal assistant, herding the Ashterai Elders.
This is the story, mainly, of what happens after that when Zoe moves to Seattle, takes on a human form and becomes embroiled in the fallout of Contact, the rise of the Bureau of Esper Affairs and Registration and becomes a secret agent, becoming a teacher for psychics in order to find the soulmate she's lost.
I’ll publish each one and then do an omnibus at the end and if I do this right, it will bridge the gap between the first and second Chaya and Josh novels, Lesser Evils (set in 2015-2016) and An Inherited State (set in 2018, starting a couple of days post the epilogue of A Star Filled Sea). There will be a companion volume which concludes Zoe's story, When Darkness Eclipses Light which I hope to Kickstart next year.
If each segment is around 25k-30k in length, that’s a 115k novel. I know from my own levels that unless I’m manic, it’s really hard to keep my interest on one project for long enough to finish it. I jump from thing to thing and this will allow me to keep writing from Zoe’s perspective but also have another novel under my belt in less than six months.
As with the Kickstarter for A Star Filled Sea, this is basically a pre-order program and, if you back all four campaigns, I'll send you a copy of the omnibus edition for free. How does that sound?
Want to Read It?
The Children's Ward
Shellshocked
Why am I doing a Kickstarter?
A part of the reason I like Kickstarter are the people. I'm constantly amazed by the generosity of my tribe (that's you guys, my various teams) and strangers.
I live on a fixed-income which is rather tiny. I found from my first three Kickstarters that it doesn't matter how well you do the sums to plan things, it never quite goes as it should. However I've now reached the point where I have to keep my life/personal finances far away from my Kickstarter campaigns.
The bottom line is I cannot afford to do this unless we fund the campaign so I need your help to make this happen. If this campaign is successful, it means I can get on an finish writing the second half of the duology.
One of my favourite parts about Kickstarter is that I love the communal side which comes with crowdfunding. I get to talk to my backers, to take them with me on each roller-coaster ride of a journey, knowing they'll queue up for the next go.
We did Changing, we aced Parting and then we had fun with Star. Now it's time to do it again but, this time, for something slightly different.
 A World of Strange New Things is a longer project but I'm really enthusiastic about trying as an experiment in a form of storytelling which will both help my long-term health condition but also allow me to reward you guys with another novel.
Plus serials are cool. I love them.
Team Changing was the reason my first Kickstarter succeeded and I remain indebted to each and every one of the sixty two people who backed me, ditto the eighty two people who backed Parting. I might write the books but I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for the support and the faith of the kind people who took a leap of faith on my project. I want you to be a part of their journey, any financial assistance is just a bonus.
What is the money for?
Covers and the artwork for each part of the serial.
You can get a taste of the concepts for each cover below (I love them) but we are looking at five covers here, not one, and that is, in part, why the campaign goal is higher. There's Shutterstock art to pay for, the covers in ebook and print, but, that said, I firmly believe they're worth it:
Part 1—Sweetness in Sorrow © Scarlett Rugers
Part 2—Temporal Grace © Scarlett Rugers
Part 3—Suffer the Children © Scarlett Rugers
Part 4—Games the Powerful Play © Scarlett Rugers
Scarlett Rugers is back to work her magic on the ebook and print covers. She's the uber-talented designer behind the cover for The Whispers of the Desert, the bonus novella I gave away with my first Kickstarter campaign and A Star Filled Sea. I'm hiring her to do the four covers for the serial but also the omnibus edition for consistancy.
Editing A World of Strange New Things to make it publishable. 
Editors cost money and I want to make sure my books are as close to perfect as I can get them, this means hiring a good and thorough editor. 
e-book and print formatting for the serial and omnibus edition.
I heard about Polgarus Studio via Hugh Howey (which is like the highest recommendation you can get in the indie publishing world). I hired them to format Whispers, Changing and Parting for me. I never regretted it; it's delegation, Jason Anderson does a wonderful job and I know he will take a lot of the load off me. He will do both the e-book (in .mobi, Smashwords and .epub) of each instalment of A World of Strange New Things as well as the printed layouts for me and it will look amazing.
Obvious, as this is a serial, there will be four different books (each novella sized), as well as the omnibus edition so that's a lot more complex than just one book but I know it's going to be worth it.
The costs of the various rewards and shipping
Print copies and art cards will all cost money and this is something that final amount has to include. This should also cover mailing out print editions and cards to the lucky people who pledged for them.
Again, lots of things to ship and postage always costs more than you suspect it will. I plan to mail out an instalment a month, keeping everyone in print editions soon after the ebook is release.
It sounds silly but, as I've learned to my cost in the previous Kickstarters, shipping always ends out costing the most in your budget. Not only do I have to pay to get the books shipped to the UK, I then have to ship them to you guys. It's a depressingly high amount of money and I would really, really like to get it right this time. Or, at least, come close. 
To give you an idea, in a previous campaign, I spent over £750 on the purchase of books alone and another £400 on shipping. You can see why I'm very keen that this be correctly guesstimated. Though lighter, there's a lot of more shipping and a lot more books.
Kickstarter and Amazon's fees. 
Kinda obvious but if I reach my goal, Kickstarter get a percentage and so do Amazon for processing the payments. Go figure. 
Here's a basic breakdown of where everything is going in a handy pie chart:
Who am I?
I'm a storyteller, I always have been. I started writing at ten, teaching myself to touch type as well as how to use computers. I spent a decade working in journalism, as a blogger and a reviewer before chronic depression, anaemia and a combination of my physical disabilities pushed me into early retirement. 
I even retrained as a teacher but my health issues mean I'm never going to be able to work again, which makes me sad but does nothing to negate the sheer exhaustion of suffering a chronic illness. I found writing to be cathartic, to be the one way I have to stay sane and I'm not going to stop. I wrote a novel, then I wrote short stories and now I'm publishing them.
I've always been visually impaired and this is no more obvious by the number of blind characters who crop up in my stories. In my case I have retinopathy of prematurity due to being born at twenty four weeks which left me with white matter damage to my brain from too much oxygen, a blind right eye and a blurry left one. I also have Asperger's though that can sometimes be more of a boon than a bane, especially when it comes to research. Three and a half years ago I qualified with my lovely guide dog, Unis, and she serves me very well, allowing me to go out safely as well as keeping me company while I write.
© Richard Steer
Hey look, it's the sequel!
For nearly a decade I freelanced for everyone - seriously, the list is as long as my arm - from anime magazines like NEO and Newtype USA to games publications including Kotaku and Official Xbox Magazine to newspapers like the Eastern Daily Press and The Guardian. Now I am recreating myself as an author, specifically focusing on science fiction and urban fantasy.
I'm in the prime of life, apparently, so being retired as due to my disabilities is incredibly frustrating as I would love to work and put my skill sets to good use.
In February 2014 my debut Kickstarter campaign for The Changing of the Sun, the first book in the trilogy, funded at 115% of the goal. In April, I distributed a prequel e-novella called The Whispers in the Desert to my backers. In September, the novel itself found its way into backers' hands and it was a thing of beauty. I ran my second campaign in November 2014 and that also funded (just!) which allowed me cover the costs associated with publishing The Parting of the Waters.
We even ended up in our local newspaper.
Edit: Make that three times.
We also went on Radio Norfolk to talk about well ... everything.
I also went on the RNIB's Insight Radio to discuss being a visually impaired author, Kickstarter and writing.
Now it's time to do it all again but this time the pressure is off. This Kickstarter is about covering a much smaller cost and offering up a new story for my team, a standalone story that is canon but at the same time my homage to murder mysteries.
I hope you join me as we venture into A World of Strange New Things.
Click me
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As someone who has run three successful campaigns, I'm getting the hang of this crowdfunding lark. The success of my first campaign and the existence of print copies can only bode well, my indie toolbox is now a well-oiled machine.

I'm crowdfunding this not just because of the financial side but, rather, because I want to make sure there's a need. By definition, if people pledge, then there are folks who want to read this short novel and so we're all good.

The manuscript is complete (bar a final pass for Tuckerisation), it's just a matter of handing the file over to be edited and then giving it to Other Jason to do the layout. This is, compared to the other books I've done, a nice project, short and easy with very little for me to do except fire up the toolbox and let them take my manuscript and turn it into a Proper Book™.

updates.update_userinfo: We're Not Going to Make It.
updates.update_content:
Short of a miracle (those happen, right?) I don't think we're going to raise the needed £4k. This is okay (and I'm still getting backers). I'm just going to let the campaign run down and then re-work the numbers, try to shave off the amount needed and then relaunch, though it probably won't be until next year.
Thank you for your support, it really has been invaluable and I'm going to take the lessons learned and relaunch with a better project, a lower goal and all the knowledge I've gained from the failure of this project.

I'm not very well right now, a lovely combination of a chest infection and depression mixed in with having to face the cold harshness of reality for the first time in years. I'm too used to being manic, to letting that 'can do' attitude push past any fears or reservations.
I've spent this year trying to sort out my life and, right now, I'm at rock bottom. I want to do this Kickstarter but I'm not sure I'm physically well enough, mentally or psychologically, to deal with the pressure. I've having enough problems with the logistics of the three boxes of books in my living room to wonder if I ever actually want to do a Kickstarter with print editions ever again.

campaign.story:
We are a group of architecture students at the California College of the Arts in San Francisco who are designing & building a "museum of the street" --a mobile exhibition space to raise awareness of homeless youth in San Francisco-- with our community partner, a local non-profit, Larkin Street Youth Services.
Larkin Street Youth Services provides a range of services to homeless and at risk youth in San Francisco and has been particularly critical to the support of the young LGBTQ community here. We are working directly with their Youth Advisory Board, outreach and arts programs to display creative expressions of homeless and at risk youth as well as serve as a touchstone for outreach, and communication of their mission.
Our work  has been selected to be one of fifty installations to be included in the upcoming San Francisco Market Street Prototyping Festival this April 9-11, 2015. The festival is promoting a broad range of full-scale design prototypes to improve urban streets as more engaged and vibrant spaces. But, we need additional funds to pull this off!
Urban street beautification projects such as this festival, often confuse “beauty” with cleanliness, sweeping the unsavory realities of the street aside. Our Guerilla Street Museum hopes to serve as a model for engaging and activating the street while simultaneously revealing and critiquing what beautification projects often hide.  Please help us complete the project!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
On April 8th, 2015, just weeks away, we are committed to installing our full scale prototype on Market Street. It must be well built, safe, and able to withstand the interaction of thousands of people over the course of the three day festival. We are building everything ourselves and trying to use recycled materials when we can, but we simply don't have the funds to purchase everything that is needed. Please help us reach our goals in this final crunch!

campaign.story:
Blood Rage is a Viking board game created by acclaimed game designer Eric M. Lang. In this fast-paced yet highly strategic game, 2 to 4 players take control of Viking clans, invading, pillaging and battling in a quest to gain as much glory as possible before Ragnarök finally consumes the land!
Here's a look at everything we've unlocked!
From Guillotine Games, the studio that brought you Zombicide, comes the ultimate Viking saga. The game's striking visuals are a combination of Adrian Smith’s highly evocative artwork, and Mike McVey’s amazingly detailed miniatures. Blood Rage comes with 46 pre-assembled miniatures, including some huge and impressive legendary monsters.
Viking warriors and leaders of the Bear and Raven clans.
Viking warriors and leaders of the Serpent and Wolf clans.
The dragon ships of all clans.
Völur Witch and Fire Giant
 Sea Serpent and Troll
 Frost Giant and Valkyrie
Visit the Blood Rage Facebook page for more pictures, insight, and news on the game!
In Blood Rage, each player controls their own Viking clan’s warriors, leader, and ship. Ragnarök has come, and it’s the end of the world! It’s the Vikings’ last chance to go down in a blaze of glory and secure their place in Valhalla at Odin’s side! For a Viking there are many pathways to glory. You can invade and pillage the land for its rewards, crush your opponents in epic battles, fulfill quests, increase your clan's stats, or even die gloriously either in battle or from Ragnarök, the ultimate inescapable doom.
Most player strategies are guided by the cards drafted at the beginning of each of the three game rounds (or Ages). These “Gods’ Gifts” grant you numerous boons for your clan including: increased Viking strength and devious battle strategies, upgrades to your clan, or even the aid of legendary creatures from Norse mythology. They may also include various quests, from dominating specific provinces, to having lots of your Vikings sent to Valhalla.
Most of these cards are aligned with one of the Norse gods, hinting at the kind of strategy they support. For example, Thor gives more glory for victory in battle, Heimdall grants you foresight and surprises, Tyr strengthens you in battle, while the trickster Loki actually rewards you for losing battles, or punishes the winner.
Players must choose their strategies carefully during the draft phase, but also be ready to adapt and react to their opponents’ strategies as the action phase unfolds. Battles are decided not only by the strength of the figures involved, but also by cards played in secret. By observing your opponent’s actions and allegiances to specific gods, you may predict what card they are likely to play, and plan accordingly. Winning battles is not always the best course of action, as the right card can get you even more rewards by being crushed. The only losing strategy in Blood Rage is to shy away from battle and a glorious death!
Game Components
46 highly detailed miniatures
52 colored plastic bases
99 cards
4 clan sheets
36 cardboard tokens
4 plastic glory markers
1 game board
2 support sheets
1 rulebook
Pledge Level
Your Ragnarok-level pledge gets you the Blood Rage core game as well as the Kickstarter exclusive Wolfman monster, and any stretch goals we manage to unlock! The Wolfman comes with his figure and a card to add him to your Age II deck.
Note that anything marked with this:
is an exclusive item for Kickstarter backers, with remaining stock available at conventions only.
Full Gameplay Video
Our bloodthirsty friends at Jogando Offline gathered together for a game of Blood Rage. Check out the video below to see how it went.
Rulebook
http://cmon.co/BR_Rules_Preview
Please be aware that this is an Alpha Rulebook. It is not final. Rules may still be tweaked and changed, layout and graphics may still be altered. So, if you see anything in here that isn't the same later, understand that during the Kickstarter the project is still in development and all aspects are subject to improvements.
Stretch Goals
Optional Buys
Explore the 5th Player Expansion HERE!
Explore the Art Book HERE!
Shipping information - Please take note
Based on past experience, we will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship. We will collect this via our pledge manager after the campaign ends. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.  
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship you from our hub in Germany (EU backers), China (Asia Pacific backers), Canada (Canadian backers), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers) or Atlanta (USA and the rest of the world). As a rough estimate, the game will cost about $10 to ship in the USA and to Hong Kong, about $15 to Australia, about $15-$25 in the EU and Canada, all the way up to $50 to Singapore and South America,  but this may increase or decrease based on the quantity of stretch goals we might unlock and your carrier choices.
Please note that while we do our best to get you your rewards in a timely manner, you may not necessarily receive your rewards before the product makes it into distribution in your own country or before it's made available in conventions and special promotion opportunities. We hope that the special price and exclusive items you will get during the Kickstarter will make up for any such possible lag. However, if this is something that is not acceptable to you, please do not back this project, and instead wait for the retail release. Thank you for your understanding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 16th Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:

Production delays 
Shipping delays 
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date is September 2015, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all. Since the game is 90% complete, we don't believe this is in the least bit likely - we've successfully delivered Zombicide, Sedition Wars, Guilds of Cadwallon, Zombicide Season 2, Relic Knights, Rivet Wars, Kaosball, Dogs of War, Arcadia Quest, and Wrath of Kings. We are in the final stages of delivery for Zombicide Season 3 and XenoShyft.

We have three ongoing projects currently: our Base System, which is in the final stages of production, The World of Smog: On Her Majesty's Service, and Rum & Bones.

Please refer to our individual project pages if you'd like to check the progress there. Each project is entirely independent of each other and have completely different development teams and have no effect on the production flow or development of Blood Rage.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 60 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 60 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 60 days close of the campaign are processed via Paypal only. Within 60 days refunds are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Where’s Wallet is…
1) The Wallet You’ll Never Lose
Thanks to cutting edge technology, each wallet features a thin, unobtrusive sensor, so you never have to replace your wallet, or its contents, ever again. 
2) Easy to Operate
Download the free Where’s Wallet app, set a notification range, and your phone/wallet will beep to alert you the moment you step beyond the preset range. Use the app to guide you back, and you’ll find your wallet, safe and sound.
3) Stylish
Available in 3 classic designs: the slip, bi-fold and clutch. Each wallet is constructed with 100% vegetable-tanned leather: a rich, full grain leather that establishes a handsome, distinct patina as it ages. 
4) Affordable
Starting at $49, you’ll receive a sturdy, vegetable-tanned leather wallet with a classic, understated look. More than a durable, visually appealing accessory, it seamlessly integrates innovative sensor technology so that you’ll never lose it again. 
Our Story
MIJLO arose from a desire to build an essential collection of well-designed goods - a collection established with A Better Backpack and The Everyday Watch. After a pair of successful Kickstarter campaigns, our focus shifted to the most essential of items: The Wallet. 
Why a Wallet? 
The wallet is a crucial everyday accessory that carries our most important belongings: ID, health card, credit card, bank card, and cash. If misplaced, the fallout is not just costly, it’s time consuming. 
After months of discussion and careful research, our design team settled on two key points: 
Every wallet should be impossible to lose.
Every wallet should be simply designed and easy to use.
The result is a well designed wallet that blends understated style with practical, user-friendly technology. 
Easy to Operate, Impossible to Lose
Rewards 
Minimal design and cutting edge technology are a hallmark of all 3 models, including:
The Slip: $49 on Kickstarter
The Slip features three slim card pockets and a larger slot for cash. Smart, simple and thin, it is made with 100% full grain, vegetable-tanned leather and stitched with high abrasion nylon. Each edge is hand-sealed to prevent excess wear. 
The Bi-fold: $69 on Kickstarter
For those in need of a little more space, the Bi-fold is large enough to carry daily essentials and slim enough to reduce pocket bulk. Made with 100% full grain, vegetable-tanned leather, its natural patina will develop a unique look over time while retaining its original hue. 
The Clutch: $99 on Kickstarter
The Clutch is an understated, versatile piece fit for a variety of occasions. Made with a rich, pebbled leather, each piece features subtle gold accents and is precision-stitched with high abrasion nylon thread. 
More Colors for All Three Wallets On the Way
App Features
Quick, Effortless Set Up
Download your free Where’s Wallet app and activate it in seconds. 
Set Your Notification Range
After you’ve activated the app, set a notification range, and your phone will alert you the moment you step beyond the preset range.
Retrieve Your Wallet
Navigate your way back with the distance meter, which tracks your proximity to the wallet. Activate Where’s Wallet’s audio sensor to locate it quickly. 
Out of Range Alert
The moment you step out of range, your wallet will beep and trigger a phone alert for swift recovery.  
Location Last Seen
If you happen to turn off the notification range and your wallet is misplaced, you can view its last known location to retrace your steps. 
Wallet Specs
Upcoming Features
We love the current incarnation of Where’s Wallet, but a product that pairs with a mobile app allows us to improve and enhance the original model as we see fit. Here are a handful of potential features we’d like to include in the near future:
Radar Tracking
Locate your wallet with increased speed and accuracy. Radar tracking capabilities allow us to enhance a variety of search tools, including an upgraded version of our app’s “Locate” function. 
Location-Based Smart Settings
Create custom notification ranges for home, work, or anywhere you’d like, and our app will automatically adjust the range when you arrive. 
Phone Finder
If you’ve lost your phone, activate its ringtone with a quick shake to locate it promptly. 
Apple Watch Compatibility
Apple Watch’s wrist tap capabilities are a natural fit for Where’s Wallet. This intuitive technology will tap your wrist the moment you exceed the preset notification barrier, and promptly guide you to the misplaced accessory with directional vibrations. 
Where’s Wallet? You Tell Us! 
MIJLO has created an interactive game that enables players to track down Where’s Wallet and earn a handful of MIJLO extras. Up to the challenge? Explore the illustrated map to find our wallet and 25 tech icons like Mark Zuckerberg, Myspace Tom, Angry Birds, and Dancing Baby. 
Play now!
Join the MIJLO Collective
We believe that interesting, intelligent design stems from the imagination of a like-minded collective. Above all, we enjoy creative collaboration.
When you back MIJLO, you back a vision that you're encouraged to be a part of. Join us, let's see what else we can dream up.

campaign.story:
Exploding Kittens is a highly strategic kitty-powered version of Russian Roulette. Players take turns drawing cards until someone draws an exploding kitten and loses the game. The deck is made up of cards that let you avoid exploding by peeking at cards before you draw, forcing your opponent to draw multiple cards, or shuffling the deck.

The game gets more and more intense with each card you draw because fewer cards left in the deck means a greater chance of drawing the kitten and exploding in a fiery ball of feline hyperbole.
The game was created by Elan Lee (Xbox, ARGs), Matthew Inman (The Oatmeal), and Shane Small (Xbox, Marvel).  We think this game combines all the things we're best at creating, and and put together this Kickstarter campaign because we can't build this without you.
So if you're into card games or laser beams or weaponized enchiladas, please help us make this game a reality.  We think you'll love it as much as we do.
Hugs and enchilada kisses, 
-Elan, Matt, and Shane.
The Origin Story
Exploding Kittens started when Shane Small proposed a game to Elan Lee where a joker was inserted into a deck of cards and they took turns picking cards until the joker came up. It was called “Bomb Squad” and it wasn’t any fun at all.
Over the next few weeks, two important things happened: First, after neglecting work, family, and a social life, Shane and Elan developed a rule-set that started working and brought the game to life. Second, Matt Inman saw the game, thought it was super fun, and asked to join the team. (btw, if Matthew Inman ever asks you if he can join your team, the answer is “HELL YES”.)
We changed the name to "Exploding Kittens" and our little team was born.
BUT YOU'RE BLOWING UP KITTENS! NOT COOL, BUDDY.
We struggled with this a lot. We love the name Exploding Kittens, but we don't want to hurt kittens. We also don't want the kittens to be hurt by anyone else. Eventually we decided to explore the concept of the kittens blowing themselves up.
First, Matt tried drawing the kittens as the actual bombs:
But that felt too Angry Birds’ish.
Next, we tried making the kittens suicidal, but that felt terrible.
In the end, we realized that everyone understands feline shenanigans, and that could be our solution.  Our kitties would not blow up out of malicious intent or negligence, but by doing the things that kittens do, like running across keyboards or chewing on things they shouldn't be chewing on.
From there, the rest of the cards fell into place, and the cards used to defuse the exploding kittens were items you'd use to defuse regular kittens.
HELP US BUILD THIS GAME
We wanted to put this project on Kickstarter because it's the fastest way for us to get the game into your hands and make improvements as a community.  We think this game is great, but we need your help making it even better.
So, if a world full of weaponized pork missiles is a world you want to live in, please back this project and help us build this game. 

With love and pork missiles,
-The Exploding Kittens Team  (Matt, Elan, and Shane)

--------------------------------------------------------------------
For more information about the game: http://www.explodingkittens.com

Follow us:  Facebook  Twitter

Music: Royalty-free music from Bensound.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Production of the game is simple: it's just a card game, so other than building the box it's a relatively straightforward product to make. The biggest challenge for us would actually be if you blow us out of the water. We're already working with our pals at Cards Against Humanity to make sure that no matter how many people pledge, everyone gets their Exploding Kittens quickly after the campaign ends. None of us want this to be a campaign where you spend the next two years getting fifty emails about production updates and delays. If you back this project, we want to be sure you can start blowing up your friends as soon as possible. This is why (for now) we're not offering t-shirts or other complicated reward tiers that would make the distribution process take a lot longer. We're keeping it as simple as possible: support our project and in return we'll send you the playable game.

Missed out on the Kickstarter campaign? No worries! Head to http://www.paperwallet.com to order your artist accessories. 
Paperwallet set out to create what was to become truly a breakthrough accessory. By fusing function, comfort and design, Paperwallet created a wallet that was paper-thin, ultra-durable and eco - friendly, using a material called Tyvek.
SLIM
Tyvek is an ultra-thin and ultra-durable material that allows us to create a wallet with 100% functionality that is really thin and very comfortable to be more in tune our everyday.
EXPANDABLE
Origami inspired, the wallet has been engineered to expand with use. Our head designer engineered the wallet to be folded in such a way that will allow the wallet to expand as you add to your wallet that keeps all of your needs in a wallet that is impossibly thin.
DURABLE
The strength and durability of the wallet is due to: 
The Super Strong Tyvek® Material
Structural Inserts – strengthens the wallets shape
Ingenious Origami Design – made from only 1 sheet without seams or stitches.
The wallet is made from Tyvek® which is a super strong, durable, and eco-friendly material made by Dupont.  One sheet of Tyvek is printed, cut, folded and glued in origami fashion to create a wallet without any seams or stitches.  The wallet is also reinforced with recyclable structural inserts that further strengthen the structure of the wallet and help it keep its shape. 
THE COLLECTION - Choose your wallet!
                          SUPPORT THE ARTISTS
Our focus is to be a platform for the artist so get their art and names out there, while creating artistic accessories that are as comfortable as they are exciting.
The best part of what Paperwallet does is finding new artists with something to say, and something to share.
WHAT IS TYVEK?
Tyvek is elastic, waterproof, and long-lasting, and is built to keep up with your busy life. With the planet in mind, Tyvek paper is an eco-friendly material that is being incorporated into fashion design across all categories.
The Tyvek itself is made in part from post-consumer recycled plastic and is 100% recyclable!

PRODUCTION PROCESS
Product design team designed the perfect wallet from a single piece of Tyvek.This template becomes the canvas for the artist to design.
Through extensive collaborations with incredible artist from around the world, each wallet is fully customized.Each corner from the outside to the cash compartment is thought-out and designed by the artist.

SPECS
Impossibly Thin – 3 millimeters
Credit Cards - Up to 12 credit cards
Long Lasting – Paperwallet products
Recyclable – 100% recycles made in part from post consumer recycled content
Large Side Pockets – Easy access to what you need on the fly.
Interior cash compartment card slots – Extra slots so you can organize your wallet the way YOU want.

THE TEAM
Elad Burko - An entrepreneur from New York with passion for art and product design.
Burko’s fascination started with wanting to know how things work, and at an early age he was disassembling and reassembling any product that struck his curiosity.  Burko grew up in an artistic home and absorbed creativity from his family members.  Being the least artistically talented of the bunch, Burko studied business and found a way to combine his teachings with his love for art and product design in the creation of the Paperwallet brand and platform for artists.
Gilli Cherrin - An academic with a passion for people, the environment, and giving back to society. 
In Gilli’s view there are many subcultures in society today and they are making their own mind up about what they like and are not accepting the status quo of yesterday.He believes this will created demand for more creative and unique products and brands that will lead the way in tomorrow’s marketplace.Gilli’s vision is to create such a brand with innovative products that will serve as a platform for artists around the globle to do what they love and live off of it.

campaign.story:
Help publish my novel The Parting of the Waters, the second volume in a science fiction trilogy set on an alien world.
We are funded!
Thank you, Team, you're awesome and I wouldn't be here without each and everyone of you!
This is all thanks to you!
Who am I?
I'm a storyteller, I always have been. I started writing at ten, teaching myself to touch type as well as how to use computers. I spent a decade working in journalism, as a blogger and a reviewer before chronic depression, anaemia and a combination of my physical disabilities pushed me into early retirement. 
I even retrained as a teacher but my health issues mean I'm never going to be able to work again, which makes me sad but does nothing to negate the sheer exhaustion of suffering a chronic illness. I found writing to be cathartic, to be the one way I have to stay sane and I'm not going to stop. I wrote a novel, then I wrote short stories and now I'm publishing them.
I've always been visually impaired and this is no more obvious by the number of blind characters who crop up in my stories. In my case I have retinopathy of prematurity due to being born at twenty four weeks which left me with white matter damage to my brain from too much oxygen, a blind right eye and a blurry left one. I also have Asperger's though that can sometimes be more of a boon than a bane, especially when it comes to research. Three and a half years ago I qualified with my lovely guide dog, Unis, and she serves me very well, allowing me to go out safely as well as keeping me company while I write.
© Richard Steer
For nearly a decade I freelanced for everyone - seriously, the list is as long as my arm - from anime magazines like NEO and Newtype USA to games publications including Kotaku and Official Xbox Magazine to newspapers like the Eastern Daily Press and The Guardian. Now I am recreating myself as an author, specifically focusing on science fiction and urban fantasy.
I'm in the prime of life, apparently, so being retired as due to my disabilities is incredibly frustrating as I would love to work and put my skill sets to good use.
In February 2014 my debut Kickstarter campaign for The Changing of the Sun, the first book in the trilogy, funded at 115% of the goal. In April, I distributed a prequel e-novella called The Whispers in the Desert to my backers. In September, the novel itself found its way into backers' hands and it was a thing of beauty.
We even ended up in our local newspaper.
Edit: Make that three times.
We also went on Radio Norfolk to talk about well ... everything.
I also went on the RNIB's Insight Radio to discuss being a visually impaired author, Kickstarter and writing.
Now it's time to do it all again. I've spent most of the year getting the first draft of the second novel, The Parting of the Waters, down on paper. I'm really excited about this one as it not only expands on the world I introduced in Changing, but allows me to explore different facets of my alien world from a whole new set of perspectives.
About The Parting of the Waters
My magnum opus is the Ashteraiverse, a multi-work tale of the future and the past set on many worlds. The Changing of the Sun trilogy is my opening gambit and now it's time to revisit the sun-battered world of Coronis with the second volume of the trilogy.
The covers for the entire trilogy as created by Jason Gurley
Coronis has changed so much since the Changing of the Sun, a cataclysmic event which saw a solar storm batter the planet and, guided by Saiara, their inexperienced Oracle, the people fled north and were driven underground, surrounded by rock and the protection of the ages.
Map of Reskha: After the Changing of the Sun (Created by Rob Antonishen of http://www.cartocopia.com)
Time passed and the people changed and then, just like that, the cataclysm ended and it was time to rebuild.
Eventually, of course, the exiles begin to return home. This is the story of the Reclaiming, when towns were refounded, cities brought back from ruin and fresh sets of eyes looked on the past and saw reason where there had once been blind faith. Now their eyes look not just to the land but to the stars and what might be waiting for them out there.
As with The Changing of the Sun, the book is narrated from multiple perspectives from the diver An'she to an alien girl cut off from her home, Maros the inventor and Jannah, the current Oracle. Some of them you've met before in other guises, others you'll be crossing paths with for the first time. Some you might recognise by other names and, like me, greet as you would old friends wearing new, less shabby clothes.
This is a story about rediscovery, about Contact and about how high a race can soar if given the room—and the chance—to fly.
Want to know more?
You can check out my Pinterest mood board for the book by clicking here. 
Here's the opening, a sample from the second chapter and another from later in the book.
The cover—one of the last Jason Gurley created before his retirement from cover design—is already done:
Jason Gurley did the covers for all three books, one of his last projects before his retirement from cover designing.
 Isn't it gorgeous?
Why am I doing a Kickstarter?
I live on a fixed-income which is rather tiny. I could pay for all these things but it would take fives times as long and I love the communal side which comes with crowd-funding, I get to talk to my backers, to take them with me on each roller-coaster ride of a journey, knowing they'll queue up for the next go.
You can see the full breakdown of how much Kickstarting Changing and the prequel novella actually cost me. I've done this to be as open, honest and transparent about the figures as possible.
Team Changing was the reason my first Kickstarter succeeded and I remain indebted to each and every one of the sixty two people who backed me. I hope they'll become part of Team Parting too. I might write the books but I wouldn't be here if it wasn't for the support and the faith of the kind people who took a leap of faith on my project. I want you to be a part of their journey, any financial assistance is just a bonus.
What is the money for?
Editing Parting to make it publishable.
I've been lucky enough to find an editor who loves my work almost as much as I do and also happens to be a perfectionist. I insist on paying Ellen for her time and so the bulk of the Kickstarter is going to cover her fee to turn my pile of muddy rock into a beautiful shards. She's totally worth it.
Illustrations 
While I was doing Changing I came across Ben J. Adams via his illustrations for Hugh Howey's Sand and Michael Bunker's Pennsylvania. I subscribe to the Michael Bunker School of Independent Authorship which mean making the best product you can because that's how much you care about it. As with Changing (which came out of my own pocket and was so worth it, I cried), I envision commissioning Ben to do panels which separate each 'act' of the book. To give you an idea, this beauty is what he created for Changing:
© Ben J. Adams
e-book and print formatting
I heard about Polgarus Studio via Hugh and Tim Grahl (which is like the highest recommendation you can get in the indie publishing world). I hired them to format Whispers and Changing for me. I never regretted it; it's delegation, Jason Anderson does a wonderful job and I know he will take a lot of the load of me. He will do both the e-book (in .mobi and .epub) as well as the printed layout for me and it will look amazing.
As with Changing, print and ebook copies will be made available first to Team Parting and then to everyone else and I have Parting set for a Summer 2015 general release. 
Wanna see how big Parting will be? If it's anything like Changing, it should be pretty big.
All my books are 5 by 8, for the sake of scale, Chimes at Midnight is a standard-sized American trade paperback
The costs of the various rewards
Print copies, posters and art cards will all cost money and this is something that final amount has to include. I under-budgeted massively for this last time around and I'm not going to do that again. Also the print copies are large, bulky and heavy and sending one copy outside of the country cost nearly £10 ... so yeah ... 
Kickstarter and Amazon's fees. 
Kinda obvious but if I reach my goal, Kickstarter get a percentage and so do Amazon for processing the payments. Go figure. 
Here's a basic breakdown of where everything is going in a handy pie chart:
Rewards
This time I'm going to learn from my mistakes. There will be a print version, I'm also making print versions of Whispers and Changing available so that anyone who wants one can catch up. Plus there's a bundle (anyone who orders the Oracles bundle will get the first two books soon after the Kickstarter funds) so people have something to read until Parting comes out. 
The bonus anthology!
Because I'm asking for so much more, I wanted to make this Kickstarter special. I also have spent the last year writing stories set in the Ashteraiverse (the overarching universe in which the Changing trilogy is set) and this is something that is important to me. 
I want to give you, each of you, a bonus anthology for backing me. A novel-length collection of Changing/Ashteraiverse stories called Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea. 
This will unlock in print and ebook when we fund at £3000. Everyone who pledges over £15 will get copies sent out (print and/or ebook, subject to the tier levels chosen).
Yes Jason Gurley has done the cover because I asked really nicely and he is awesome. It's one of the concepts from Parting but fits beautifully with the stories I want to tell. 
The anthology itself probably won't come out until spring but I want to use this opportunity to reward you for your help, faith and financial support, to make backing me about more than just signed books and Team Parting. It will also give you something to read until Parting comes out in the summer.
I'll tell you more about that during the actual campaign but, for now, check out the glorious e-book cover: 
The gorgeous cover designed by Jason Gurley!
Introducing add-ons! 
Add-ons are something I've come to appreciate, having backed a number of projects where the basic model was enticing but the option to add extras in just sweetened the deal. 
These lovely art cards can be yours!
So, for example, let's say you really liked the art cards but got Whispers and Changing in the last Kickstarter? You're awesome! However what if you pledged, for example, for the £15 print or ebook edition of Parting but really want the art cards? You can have them! 
Pledge what you can, that's the important bit. A couple of quid is better than nothing. Specify a tier if you want to be specific, then just select one of the following:
Add in £5 for a copy of all three art cards and tell me you want them when I send out the backer questionnaire at the end of the campaign. 
Add in £15 for a signed trio of A3 posters showing the covers (plus £5 for shipping). I'll sign them too if you like.
The important thing is I want to give you guys as many options when it comes to formats/extras as possible. These are also the nicest and easiest, for me and my flagging energy levels, to get re-printed.
Then, at the end, when we come to the Backer Surveys, I'm going to need you to tell me what you want and I will thus brave the post office once more to ensure everything gets sent out.
Guide dog/frame not included!
 Key Dates
7th October-7th November
The campaign! NaNoWriMo! All the things! Once the campaign ends, there is a fourteen day delay before Kickstarter transfers the funds.
24th November
I'll order the requested physical copies of Whispers and Changing along with art cards and any posters ordered.
December
Any print copies will be mailed out along with add-ons like posters/art cards. Hopefully most UK-backers will get their copies in time for Christmas/Yule.
January
Parting will be finished and handed over to be beta-read with editing to follow at the end of January. 
Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea will be planned out ready for Ellen to start editing with the new year.
October-February
I start talking to Ben about art (I will probably do this earlier but some aspects involve the layout being ... well laid out ... first). Not everything in publishing happens neatly one after the other but, instead, sort of at the same time. 
Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea will go to Ellen to be edited and then to Polgarus who will work their magic.
January to April
Rewriting, editing and stress. No seriously, it'll be fine. At this point I know what needs doing, when and how much it costs.
March
Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea will go out to backers in ebook with print to follow
April
The manuscript for Parting will go to Polgarus to be turned into ebooks/print/Smashwords. I will try not to panic too much.
May
Team Parting will get their ebook copies! Wooot! I will then order proofs, print copies and send them out to backers once they come in.
23rd June 2015
The Parting of the Waters is released publically, ditto Beyond the Stars Beneath the Sea, in print and ebook. 
The Kickstarter campaign starts for The Shadow of the Stars (including the novella One in Green, the Other Blue)!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I didn't go into my first Kickstarter blind (pun so intended!) but I did learn shedloads about the processes, about what goes into e-book and print books, about the stress and the hell of will I/won't I. 

I really hope this time will be smoother but things will still take longer than I envision they will because, you know, it just has to be like that. I might be able to control my own output but this process involves other people, layout, formatting, illustration and editing, those are my wildcards but each person I've chosen is reliable, is good at their job and it all comes right in the end.

Yes, I am asking for more money this time. However my reason for doing so is good: when I first started crowd-funding, I didn't know Michael, I'd only just heard about Ben and I wasn't thinking about doing a print edition, even if I had budgeted to get covers done so I could in future.

I lost money on my last Kickstarter (no matter how well you do your sums, exchange rates are variable, word counts change and extras always seem to cost more). I never expected to make any but I have a better understanding of costing now I've done this once. 

I can buy printed books from CreateSpace, for example, but I do get them at cost. That said, shipping remains an evil and callous mistress and the Royal Mail, now a private company, seems to be making the cost of sending anything bigger than a stamp prohibitive.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Bienvenidos! Welcome!
TerraMare will be a countryside restaurant inside an organic naturally irrigated vineyard that will conduct different sustainable practices during the project. The restaurant will serve fresh produce grown on site and the best quality ingredients from local distributors. The property will serve as a viticulture and sustainability classroom and living example for people who camp and visit us from all over the world.
Where our Tasting Room and Indoor Event Space will be located
The restaurant will be located inside Rancho La Llave which turns 75 years old next year!
With your support, our restaurant will be built in the heart of Valle de Guadalupe in Ensenada, Baja California, Mexico.
Take advantage of this great Reward! Carry your bags in style!
We will be part of a vineyard that harvests the best quality of organic grapes and produces a sulfite-free artisan wine using techniques handed down from past generations.
The vineyard does not require irrigation!
Our restaurant's principles are based on sustainable practices. For instance, the structures of the beautiful buildings are made with adobe bricks that provide a natural vibe to the setting. The water system at the property is spring fed and only relies on wind and gravity to distribute it throughout the location. Food waste from the restaurant will be composted, vegetable oil from the fryer will be turned into biodiesel and a great amount of the electric energy will be supplied by solar panels. The vineyard is naturally irrigated, meaning the only water it receives comes from rain and from subterranean moisture.
PLAY

We designed a menu that evolves from the Baja Mediterranean roots. The food we will serve will feature many of the ingredients grown on site, sustainable seafood from the beaches of Ensenada and hormone-free grass fed beef from a ranch in Mexicali. Flavors will revolve around some European influences but will portray a signature regional taste.
Cherry Tomato, Olive and Marinated Eggplant Salad topped with Caramelized Red Onion and Pine Nut sautéed in Sauvignon Blanc with Cayenne Breaded Mushrooms
Balsamic Poached Octopus with an Tomato Jam
The Main Area and the back of the Tasting Room
The restaurant will have its own Organic Garden where it will grow almost all of the ingredients we will cook with. This piece of property will be organized with raised beds made with adobe bricks and will be irrigated using the spring fed system.
Spaces will be made available for all types of events. We will cater for weddings, baptisms, company parties or weekend camping retreats for people who visit from all over the world. The property will also serve as a platform for different groups who will visit us to learn or teach about sustainability, agriculture, viticulture and culinary arts.
The Dining Room where the shade cloth will be built
Thanks to the large open fields and breathtaking scenery, the restaurant will also serve those who wish to camp at the property's camping section.
Fortunately, we already have designated a space for the kitchen and have decided on the location of an outdoor patio that faces the scenery. There will not be any construction involved in the project. We will only utilize spaces that have already been built to reduce costs in infrastructure.
There are three bathrooms ready to serve the restaurant, that rely on water from our spring fed system. These need a quick touch-up but nothing incredibly energy consuming. 
We look to serve a maximum capacity of 120 people at the restaurant, with a possible higher number (300) for events. Currently, the tourist demand in the region is not being met by other restaurants that are close to us. There is an incredible number of visitors from various places including the United States, Europe and Asia. There are two cruise ships full of people eager to discover the region that dock at Ensenada, which is only 15 minutes away, twice a week. We plan to attract people through the use of web advertising, local word of mouth and by inviting media from all of Baja California and San Diego to dine with us at the restaurant's opening. We also host local dignitaries, business owners, community leaders, celebrities and distinguished guests at the opening for an increased exposure.
One of the priorities will be to invite a large number of bloggers, food writers and wine critics to experiences the project first hand and help us by exposing it on the world wide web.
We have friends who own restaurants and although we are relatively new to owning one ourselves, we have reached out to some of them in the search of reusable equipment that they are preparing to discard from their establishments in order to install it at our location.
Restaurant equipment we already have:
30-40 wooden chairs
5 wooden silverware and plate stations for the dining room
3 wooden benches
2 wooden tables
A 4-burner range stovetop
Our Kickstarter budget includes the kitchen equipment needed for a basic restaurant operation, materials for building chairs and tables, and materials for the construction of a shade cover for the outdoor dining room. Other expenses such as  silverware, plates, cups and wine glasses, advertising, starting inventory, bar equipment and initial payroll will be covered by personal savings and a low interest loan from a local lender.
Heres our Kickstarter budget:
Construction
Reclaimed Wood for the constuction of the shadecloth cover. $3000
Reclaimed Wood the construction of 20 tables of various sizes $2500
Adobe Bricks (only have to pay for labor to make them) $250
Shade Cover (agricultural grade, potentially recycled) $600
Piping (PVC for restaurant’s water drainage) $600
Electric Cables ( for lighting and kitchen equipment) $600
Labor (considering that we will be doing most of thework) $3000
Miscellaneous (Seeds, gardening equipment, construction supplies,
Nails, screws, fittings) $1000
Total 11,550
Kitchen and Restaurant Equipment (all reused equipment)
Large 3 door fridge $1200
Large refridgerated prep table $800
3 in one Stove-Grill-Oven $2500
Fryer $800
Small Fridge $250
Small Freezer $250
Sink Rig $600
Stainless Steel Prep Table $150
Shelving $150
Miscellaneous (Pots, Pans, Bowls, Knives, Spatulas, Metal Containers
Plastic containers, squeeze bottles, cutting boards) $1000
Installation $200
Total 7,900
KICKSTARTER GOAL
19,450
Our Kickstarter goal is honestly based on the bare minimum to get this project running. The rewards we are offering are to invite the backers to form part of our initial process as a restaurant. 
Our goal is to create a haven for sustainability, helping the Earth and society by providing a space where people can visit and immerse themselves in this concepts, with the purpose of spreading knowledge and supplying meaningful experiences through our food and wine.
Please feel free to contact us through this page for any questions that might come up while you find out a little bit more about our project.
We would like to  thank you for visiting our page and would like to ask for your support to reach our $19,450 goal and kickstart this opportunity to create a place that can serve as an example for many more sustainable restaurants to come!
Gracias!

Drive to the closest supermarket from the backers home to purchase the ingredients that don't come directly from our restaurant. Arrive at the location and serve the event. Introduction and quick talk about the food. Delivery of gifts and farewell.

campaign.story:
What is it?
A beautifully designed Affirmation deck to get you out of your head and into the now, where you remember how good life really is.  
What is an affirmation?
af·fir·ma·tion [af-er-mey-shuhn] 
 1. the action or process of affirming something
2. a statement that is declared to be true.
3. emotional support or encouragement.
4. a reminder that you are awesome!
 Not only will this deck make you feel good, it looks good!  The Own Your Awesome Affirmation Deck was designed only using the colors of Red, White, Black and the stunning GOLD foil. 
Why? Well, because I love these colors.  They make the deck sleek, yet sassy, but these colors can also carry a deeper meaning. 
Colors can affect our mood and our emotions, and these four our very powerful. 
Red = Courage, Strength, Passion, Power
White = Balance, Healing,Truth, Inspiration
Black = Repels Negativity, Protection, Deep Mediation
Gold = Self-Confidence, Overcoming Bad Habits, Creativity, Luxury
{Psst. None of these test prints have the gold foil but everything that is yellow will be printed with GOLD foil, including the heart on the top of the box!}
How to use the deck:
This deck can be used a variety of ways, you could even just use it as a beautiful decoration for your coffee table.  But, of course, I suggest you actually use the cards inside. 
Start your day off inspired! Keep the box next to your bed and let an affirmation be the first thing you see in the morning to get you motivated for your day! 
Keep the deck at your workspace. When you are stressing about an unanswered email, a sudden change to schedule, or feeling stuck pick a card to turn your day around and remind you that everything will work out.
 Whenever you are feeling down, stuck, or uninspired pick a card and go to the nearest mirror. Read your affirmation out loud to yourself. Listen to and believe what you are saying. Own Your Awesome! 
Post the affirmations in places that you will see them: on your mirror, your fridge, your television, your car, your closet, your desk to shift your energy from blah to YES! Life is Good! 
Gift them out to others to brighten their days! Leave one with a tip, pack one in a lunch, leave one on a strangers car. Spread the love and inspiration around!
You can use the deck like a Magic 8 Ball, asking a question and picking a random card to get exactly what you need.  Or, you can simply search through the deck to find the card that calls fits you and your situation at that particular moment.
Read it. Say it. Believe it! Own Your Awesome!
Whats Makes Up The Deck:
52 - Affirmation Cards Each with their own unique, uplifting affirmation.  No cards have the exact same design and color scheme.  3/4 of them using GOLD foil in their design.  {everything you see in yellow will be GOLD foil}
1 - Put the Cards to Use Card giving you a few examples on what to do with the deck now that you have it.
1 - Who is Your Joyologist Card describing who I am and why I was inspired to create this deck.
All of the cards share this same back, just like a deck of playing cards would.
Each card is 4 inches x 4 inches with rounded edges printed on 350 GSM card stock with a smooth finish. 
 The 54 cards are packaged perfectly inside a stunning two part box with a GOLD foil heart on the front.  
Each deck will come cello wrapped to keep it protected, intact, and untouched before you receive it. 
Why an affirmation deck?
I have been using affirmations since at least 2008 when I started to create my Joyology.  I had been living out my biggest dream of being a live sound engineer touring around the world with Grammy Award Winning Artists and  I was often the happiest and healthiest person on the road. 
I saw first hand that even these people that we make up "have it all", that truly have what we call "success" don't wake up everyday stoked to jump out of bed.  Even with thousands of fans screaming their name, they still have rough days.  EVERYONE forgets their greatness.  EVERYONE needs daily inspiration.  
So, with the sudden loss of my father in 2008,  I was moved to make a bigger difference in the world.  I dreamed another dream and created a position for myself as a Joyologist supporting artists on the road keeping them inspired, grounded and healthy in body and mind in order to inspire others around the world. 
One of the things that I did everyday on the road as a Joyologist, was to post an affirmation in the artist's dressing rooms. 
Affirmations are quick, to the point, easily digestible nuggets of wisdom.  All the time our heads are filled with fears, worries, doubts, shame, blame. We think:
They aren't going to like it.
It's not going to work.
They are going to say no.
 I suck. 
I am so lazy.
This is so hard!
And on and on and on.  
By using affirmations you can shut down all of those negative thoughts that are swirling around in your head. 
One simple affirmation has the power to turn your day around. 
When I originally created my Joyology it was to inspire artists on the road, because that was the world that I knew.  Soon after through the power of social media I began to inspire people internationally.  I launched my website, created services, programs, and a newsletter all to inspire people to live their lives and love their lives.  
Now with this Own Your Awesome Affirmation Deck (and more merchandise items to come) I will get to inspire even more people internationally.
All I really want is for you to love every tiny bit of yourself.  
I want YOU to Own Your Awesome!  
You are uniquely you.  Be who you are.  Love who you are. 
Where is the money going?
This is actually a pretty complicated product to manufacture.  Having 54 cards each with a unique design and the majority of them using gold foil makes the printing process quite involved. 
This means that in order to have them made I need to order a high quantity, to make the decks more affordable.  Nearly all of the money will go directly to manufacturing and shipping. 
There are also a few legal and business fees to cover my ass and truly make my new product line business legit!
Any remaining money will go into investing in purchasing more decks for me to sell to stores, and also to set more inspiring and awesome products into print!
Where am I at now?
I have been working on this project for over 9 months!  I have waited to launch this Kickstarter until every tiny detail was worked out.  All designs, every word, paper stocks, sizes, researching manufacturers, everything in this deck have been fine tuned!  
I have designed  the Own Your Awesome Affirmation Deck and set everything up to make them store ready!  To make them ready to go into inventory I have purchased a barcode and ISBN number and incorporated them into the design of the box.  This way as soon as this Kickstarter Project is funded these decks will be ready to be carried everywhere from your local cute gift shop, your fun boutiques, local book stores, yoga studios and also big name chains like Anthroplology and Urban Outfitters.  
I am working with a manufacturer that is reputable and solid.  I am completely confident in using them to produce the Own Your Awesome Affirmation Deck.  I have been in communication with them for 7 months.  They are a company that specifically prints decks of cards (playing cards, tarot cards, flash cards, etc). I have talked with people who have printed decks with them and recommend them highly. 
They have sent me samples of everything that I want to do with this deck and my proofs have been approved to go to print in mass!   I am right now awaiting the final, final, final prototype which will be in my hands before this campaign has ended.
As soon as this campaign is funded the decks will go to print!
All of the affirmations in the Own Your Awesome Deck were written by Tricia Huffman.
© 2014 Your Joyologist Own Your Awesome is a trademark owned by Your Joyologist™

Hello my awesome people!

Also, big news!!!!  I am starting to get the Own Your Awesome™ deck into stores nationwide!  Many stores have contacted me wanting to sell it from seeing you all share it and tracking me down (so awesome!)  And I myself am now starting to reach out to stores that I think will be the perfect fit.

updates.update_userinfo: The Most Grateful Week Ever! ---Your Decks are in the MAIL!
updates.update_content:
What a perfect week for the decks to finally arrive!  I mean I would have loved if they had actually come in September....but really this week has been perfect. 
The first boxes came Monday and the rest Wednesday.  So, I have spent all of Thanksgiving week packaging and shipping your decks with so much love and so much gratitude.

WooHoo!
I have received the tracking number for the air freight of the decks!  They are due to arrive next Wednesday!  
So, depending on where you are in the world, your decks will get to you the first week in December! And if you are on the other side of the world, the second week!

What a journey this has been!  I promise that I truly thought I would be able to deliver in September, and then October and then November!
But, no matter what I knew I had to deliver in time for the holidays!  I got the final, full deck last week and asked for one more deck to be sent to me to double check the production.  I have given final approval.  All of the decks have been printed and packed!  
But then there was a bit of a shipping crisis, because of the approaching holiday.  They were always supposed to come by boat, but I no longer trusted the timing, so yesterday I chipped in a big chunk of money to get those decks to be shipped by plane!

Hello all!
My name is Sergio Lopez and I am making a film. This film has long been gestating in my mind and heart for many years and it wasn't until November 2012 that I finally began preparations to begin work on it. Since then I have finished the script; found my actors and begun rehearsals; scouted locations to film; and am now in the final stretches of pre-production. My main hope is to finish this film with as much love and care as it deserves, and because of this I am asking for help to do exactly that. The Kickstarter community has been amazing at helping creators reach their goals and hopefully you guys can help one more reach theirs.
- Writer/Director Sergio Lopez 
What is the movie about?
Weigh Down is a drama that centers on an aging musician that tries to reconnect with his son and his music. As he begins this journey, his past is brought back to the forefront of his life and he must now learn to cope with the things he’s done and find redemption. This film encompasses realism found in drama as well as takes inspiration from musical films such as Once. In the end Weigh Down will be a film that uses music as a device to allow the characters the ability to explore their emotions and move forward in this dramatic setting.
Official Synopsis:
Carlo Mays, an aging blues musician, has been gone from home for 10 years. During those years he has been running away from his past and drowning in the sorrows he can't seem to escape. When he finally arrives back in San Diego, Carlo tries to find what pieces of his old life still remain and most importantly his son. It isn't until he meets Jenna Young that he begins to realize there may be hope left for him and that maybe he can find redemption for the sins of his past.
What are our goals?
The goal of this project is to submit the film to high profile film festivals such as Sundance, Tribecca, and SXSW. Though Weigh Down is a micro-budget film that is being supported by the filmmakers themselves, we know that with your help we can make this film so much more than it can be by ourselves.
What you will be helping us with.
With all of your help we plan to use the donations towards submitting to film festivals, audio mixing, color correction, wardrobe, and rentals for equipment we will need through out the filming (extra lighting equipment, extra battery packs, special lenses, etc).
